Negative_Review: Location of the room and there was a waste line which was concealed behind a wall in the room so there was always the sound of a tap running water Was generally a lot of noise around the room Check Clerk mixed up my name with another guest and allocated me to wrong room which had a later check out date that took forever to change Asked for a late check out after a 4 day stay and had to pay 10 pounds per hour extra Then got locked out after 12 00 noon as the Clerk ever extended the access to the room Apologies with no consideration
Positive_Review: Great location Easy access to theatres restaurants etc

Negative_Review: Directions to the room were not clear at all I have no idea how they number the rooms but it s like a maze I wandered around various corridors for ages I objected to being charged 20 for early check in I didn t request it it was just that the room was ready when I arrived there s a difference As usual single rooms were stuck at the back with a view of 4 walls 4 90 for a cappuccino in the bar was a bit much and lukewarm Bathroom was very dated all the fittings were tarnished
Positive_Review: Breakfast was good value in comparison to other hotels and there was everything you could possibly want on the buffet Comfortable bed and room very clean Most of the staff were excellent I was able to leave my luggage there free of charge after check out as my flight was in the evening

Negative_Review: The bar area wasn t so tidy tables and bar needed a bit of a wipe
Positive_Review: Lovely treatment at reception checking in and out the man in foyer was very helpful

Negative_Review: The double bed was close up to the wall so made it only accessible from one side or the bottom You had to be quite agile
Positive_Review: Excellent position for central London

Negative_Review: The bedroom and bathroom were extremely small with very little room to move around The quilt on the bed was far too small for two people to share
Positive_Review: The breakfast selection was good apart from the choice of cereal

Negative_Review: A device charge was adders to the meal we had without telling us It was more than we would have left as a tip as it was a self service restaurant We then had two cocktails in the bar and they added yet another service charge for one drink
Positive_Review: Small but nice room Value for money

Negative_Review: My cosy room on this occasion was much more cosy than previous stays Info from computers at Reception always seem to confuse the staff there
Positive_Review: Location Complete and fuss free breakfast

Negative_Review: Only a few rooms were marked as executive rooms and appeared larger on the floor plan Our room was supposed to be executive but it seemed to be an ordinary room with a few extras squeezed in Not happy about this When queried at reception I did not get an explanation just a curt your room is executive
Positive_Review: Loved the executive breakfast room The hotel position was excellent for visiting the sights and nightlife

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: This such a fantastic hotel in a wonderful location Everything is in walking distance such as Covent Garden Leicester Square etc so there s no need to catch the tune This was our second time staying here this year and will always be our hotel of choice

Negative_Review: One of the three lifts were out of order which made waiting times for the lift quite lengthy and my bedroom shutters were broken
Positive_Review: Great location really good staff

Negative_Review: Had to ask to move rooms because of noisy air con unit outside first room Pizza I ordered up for room service was very average Don t like fixed shower heads
Positive_Review: Room clean Easy to operate TV Water nice and hot Staff pleasant

Negative_Review: Great location The hotel was clean and comfortable although the decor needed a refresh and the room was small I probably wouldn t stay there again
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Bedroom mediocre for a four star hotel Lifts very slow which prompted me to use the stairs healthier at least Couldn t get coffee at the bar early in the morning and was directed to breakfast so I left the hotel for a nearby coffee shop where I could sip my coffee and read in comfort
Positive_Review: Location was excellent and the lounge facility comfortable Staff were very friendly

Negative_Review: Room tiny Bed hard window locked shut so room was stuffy Renovations occurring and I wasn t told Room did not appear to have been well cleaned as I found rusty screws on the floor near bed
Positive_Review: Location and staff were good

Negative_Review: Stay here often Tried booking direct on Strand s Website but I got an error that booking was currently not possible Went to booking com and got a room immediately Negative Room s windows were screwed shut and could not open to draft out the hot and moist room Construction site was blocking the entire window view Some strange motor or plumbing sound was happebing through wall of bathroom that woke me up several times during my three night stay Reception staff at checkin was not very warm and not welcoming and appeared if I was bothering him during checkin Condition of Rooms Carpets in Halls is not 4x Star Outdated Room 159 is tiny 6m Sq and for The price of 180 per Night too expensive
Positive_Review: Positive Room was very clean and kept clean

Negative_Review: Small poky room for an executive room Coffee machine not working and not labelled which coffee pod was which anyway When speaking to the staff it was like everything was too much as they were busy
Positive_Review: The hotel room was darkened by scaffolding at the tiny window We moved rooms after we expressed that this was not good enough for an executive room The coffee machine did not work so we went to sainsbury s for a jar of coffee There was no bathrobe provided and they said they had run out of them I have stayed in better travel lodges for a lot less money and a better service

Negative_Review: The length of time queuing to check in
Positive_Review: My room was opposite the lift Nice and easy to find And plenty of food locations nearby for dinner and lunch

Negative_Review: Scaffolding directly outside window Double bed against wall so clambering over partner to get in out 1 towel in bathroom for 2 occupants Paper thin walls heard next door all night
Positive_Review: No positive commment

Negative_Review: Room was very small with no air conditioning so got very hot at night Windows said they opened but had in fact been screwed shut
Positive_Review: Check in and out were excellent and staff polite and helpful

Negative_Review: I was put in a single room on the first floor directly over the entrance on the main road Very noisy and uncomfortable requested to be moved which the hotel did accommodate at 12am
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: Had a fire in the basement while we were there and had to wait outside in the cold for 1 5 hours It s not the hotel s fault but it was a special occasion and we were never approached by the hotel staff for any kind of compensation
Positive_Review: We can t stress enough how great the location of this hotel is Walked the whole time to Covent Garden and Soho There s a central bus stop across from the hotel that you can get anywhere with and the tube is a 5 minute walk Perfect location and really nice hotel

Negative_Review: Overall interior of hotel needs updating looking a bit worn inside old wood paneling old carpeting that looks dirty Prices a bit high for value even with AAA discount I found better discounts later on but it was too late to change reservation No breakfast included in price
Positive_Review: Room itself was clean bathroom modern and clean Room also good space for two beds two people and suitcases

Negative_Review: Construction work happening and was very noisy including plumbing noise Only was able to sleep for 5 5 hours before the construction work started Staff offered me 20 off my next stay however nothing for this one
Positive_Review: Location is great staff friendly

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The hotel and staff were brilliant Very helpful and cheery staff Breakfast was lovely so much choice Location brilliant as easy access to everywhere Rooms clean and modern My sister and I had great time celebrating her 50th birthday Definitely will stay again

Negative_Review: Quite a long queue for check in but staff very polite and helpful Scallfolding outside the window made the room very dark
Positive_Review: Bed very comfortable and our room was very quiet at night we were on floor 6 at the rear of the hotel

Negative_Review: Staff at the door dont even help to carry lift the luggages As they dont have a ramp you need to carry it on the stares Even leaving the bags when we check out theres another stares the staff just walking beside us dont even ask if we need help
Positive_Review: The hotel near to shops

Negative_Review: The bed was too hard to sleep Like concrete Didn t like queuing for breakfast Would have liked veggie sausages
Positive_Review: Staff and surroundings excellent Hotel amazing Loved it

Negative_Review: Breakfast lukewarm and restaurant seemed disorganised Tables not being cleared quickly
Positive_Review: Room good size comfortable bed all the expected facilities

Negative_Review: Single room slightly bigger than Harry Potter s birthplace Under the stairs and a lovely view of a scaffolding erection outside the bedroom window
Positive_Review: Polite staff Clean Hotel

Negative_Review: Fire alarm went off in the middle of the night We had to evacuate for an hour Things happen but they never communicated to tenants about what was going on It was handled poorly and in an unprofessional manner
Positive_Review: Some staff were great others were unfriendly and unhelpful

Negative_Review: The fire alarm we had to leave the building and wait over an hour to get back in it was not good
Positive_Review: It is a lovely hotel and the staff were friendly

Negative_Review: The hotel was old and it would show on some parts The standard room was quite small and I m not sure how it s got 4 stars though Remember to bring a power adapter or you ll have to buy one
Positive_Review: Location was excellent The executive rooms are quite all right

Negative_Review: Room tiny especially bathroom toilet jammed between bath and wall Noisy machinery outside room If this was an executive room I d hate to see a standard room Not what I expect for 250 a night
Positive_Review: Breakfast excellent staff friendly helpful Excellent location for Covent Garden and theatreland

Negative_Review: The rooms are not air conditioned so you re somewhat stuck with the unfashionable option of opening the window if you find the room too warm as we did when we arrived This also lets in the street noise The bathroom was perfectly functional but felt a little dated As is often the case with these larger places we found a large variation in the water temperature between morning and evening While it was not cold in the morning I couldn t get as hot a shower as my partner had managed the evening before Therefore I would suggest if a hot rather than comfortably warm shower is your preference wash before you go to bed rather than after you get up in the morning We were unfortunately disturbed by a housekeeper at around 9 30am We hadn t hung a do not disturb sign out as we had assumed that given it was our check out day and check out was at noon it was unlikely that the room would be attended early In big hotels this kind of thing sometimes happens but if you fancy a lie in it might be worth putting that sign out to ensure no one comes knocking
Positive_Review: This is our second stay at the Strand Palace Hotel in the last few years Both were pleasant comfortable stays The hotel is vast some 780 rooms and all are up to the same standard while they re certainly not top of the range they are perfectly comfortable and come with everything you might wish for Our room was front facing looking down from the 3rd floor to The Strand This lead it to be somewhat noisy The Strand never really gets quiet even over night so we were thankful for the good thick windows and shutters rather than curtains which helped to keep both noise and light out The bed typically of this kind of hotel two singles zipped together was large and comfortable There were tea and coffee making facilities and the TV had plenty of channels The location of the hotel could not be better for access to central London nightlife bars tourist attractions and the West End This also means there is access to a wide range of restaurants to take breakfast lunch and dinner within a short walking distance so you need not be tied down to the hotel s own offerings That said there is a good selection of in room dining options with a more modest 24 hour menu if you just can t be bothered to go out one night As we had an afternoon in London planned on our first day we were grateful for the prompt check in at 2pm although if you do arrive on the dot of 2 then expect to queue for a few minutes and following a late night before our last day we were very happy with the 12noon check out Additionally as we had spent nothing extra during our stay we found the rapid check out just drop your keys through a letterbox very convenient

Negative_Review: Rooms shabby Views poor Lighting in rooms very poor to do hair make up etc Bathrooms very cramped Check in long queues Overall reception area poor Dated and scruffy looking Not a welcoming area
Positive_Review: Location excellent

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The hotel was ideally situated for our stay with comfortable beds and the breakfast was of good quality The staff were polite and helpful Raymond the concierge deserves a special thanks as I had a problem with Madame Tussaud s that he resolved

Negative_Review: Had to queue to book in noisy workmen and ugly view of scaffolding out of window walls very thin so woken by neighbour having shower at 6 am
Positive_Review: Great location clean excellent breakfast

Negative_Review: The room was unbelievably tiny Breakfast was poor For a vegetarian I was ill served The fruit salad was tasteless and made with much unripe fruit I doubt if the kitchen tasted it to check Cereal selection was so limited Coffee was insipid So you can see I was not impressed
Positive_Review: Only location Staff were helpful

Negative_Review: The scaffolding right outside our window
Positive_Review: The room we were given to begin with was not good enough for the amount paid We asked to move and they relocated us so that was good

Negative_Review: I really like hotel Some areas need refurbishment in corridors upstairs for example
Positive_Review: The cosy rooms are small but you know that when you book We had lovely food served in bar at 11pm on Tuesday night This was excellent service

Negative_Review: Lifts were poor 2 3 out of order for a time Leaks to the ceiling showing it s age a little Although engineers working on problems straight away
Positive_Review: Location of the hotel perfect for us a short walk to the themes Leicester square and Charing cross station Breakfast staff and service was amazing beds were comfy and room very clean

Negative_Review: Room was a bit on the small side but not a major issue as only used to sleep in
Positive_Review: Great location only 15 min stroll to Westminster and right next to Covent Garden Good breakfast choice Able to leave cases at hotel beforehand and after checking out to allow us to go out sightseeing without dragging cases around

Negative_Review: Noise from the adjoining room Music loud talking and banging doors until 3 00am on one night Also a strong smell of cigarette smoke from this room
Positive_Review: Location and the breakfast Friendly staff at reception

Negative_Review: The room was on the small side with no view
Positive_Review: Great location for the West End Theatres Covent Garden and sight seeing along the Thames We only ate breakfast and some bar snacks but the quality was good

Negative_Review: Construction work outside the window of the room wass extremely noisy and disruptive The work started early on Monday morning and woke us This disruption spoiled what would have been a pleasant stay
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: No view from the window just the back of the hotel roof air con units Bathroom was very cold mainly due to the draughty windows and no heater
Positive_Review: Great location and friendly staff Efficient check in and check out

Negative_Review: Small gripe the pillows were harder than we re used to or like Think that the plates should be warmed
Positive_Review: The location was perfect close to the theatre Covent Garden and lots of other amenities The staff were friendly and helpful The hotel was very clean Lots of choice at breakfast

Negative_Review: We choose a Cosy room because we didn t need much space and were planning to spend our time out and about We had seen the pictures and did appreciate that the bed was against the wall We didn t think this would be a problem but didn t appreciate that for the person next to the wall it would be difficult to get in or out of bed without disrupting the other My impression was that it was a single room with a double bed put in it Overall perhaps a little too small but that is our mistake we had seen the pictures D cor is showing signs of age throughout Largely well maintained it is showing its age as looking dated rather than poorly maintained or poor quality Gin Palace prices are a bit high at c 15 for a G T
Positive_Review: Very very friendly staff great Gin Palace bar with excellent choice and service excellent location room and bathroom clean although bathroom showing wear and tear Good value stay for Central London in school holidays

Negative_Review: I thought for the price we paid for the Executive Room it would have been a bit better The room had scaffolding outside although I understand that the hotel needs to be maintained it felt a bit unsafe as the window lock where broken The bathroom was clean but a bit shabby
Positive_Review: Located in the middle of the Strand great for the West End and theaters The linen and towels where clean and fresh The staff where very nice and attentive and overall appearance was very nice

Negative_Review: The room was described as cosy but it would be more accurately described as small and almost claustrophobic That may be what I booked but if do it was inadvertent Definitely too cramped
Positive_Review: The location was great and the breakfast was excellent

Negative_Review: I didn t like the knock on the door at 9 and 10 check out was at 12 as I hadn t got in till 6 am Next time I ll know to put on the do not disturb

Negative_Review: 2 lifts out of order that was pretty crap
Positive_Review: The room was excellent for once the online publicity pictures were accurate The single bedroom was more than comfortable with excellent facilities Best Blackout Blinds I ve ever had in a Hotel I am planning to book again for my Christmas Vacation

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: The room was silent whoopee staff so pleasant Comfort all the way hey and so close to all the major sights The local restaurants of every nation were on the doorstep

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: The room was cosy and comfortable the fixtures were sufficiently modern and the place was very clean What I loved the most was the central location It gives easy access to numerous entertainment options and tourist attractions For a hotel in such an excellent location it is quite reasonably priced and the service was exceptional

Negative_Review: The hotel needs renovation We had an inner room with window but it would be better if there hadn t been one Two out of three main elevators were not working

Negative_Review: Room still slightly small but didn t really matter for one night stay
Positive_Review: Upgraded and the bed was most comfortable also added discounts Ideally situated for our theatre visit

Negative_Review: Tired very tired rooms three lifts with one out of action for over a month Evening meal steak was terrible

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: Liked the very helpful friendly and lovely atmosphere Full of life and energy Didn t opt for breakfast this time but will with my next stay Very quickly found theatre tickets Will be back on my next trip to London

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The location is great close to the city and close to the west end all of which are walkable The staff are also friendly and helpful I will definitely be back

Negative_Review: I wish the price were a bit lower though I recognize this is a very expensive city I would be much more comfortable paying closer to 150 160 than the roughly 200 I did pay per night

Positive_Review: It is central and conveniently located to where I have business

Negative_Review: Can t say there was anything we didn t like

Negative_Review: Rather noisy as near the lift and sound insulation from corridor wasn t very efficient The view from the window was rather grim with a frosted lower half and wooden shutters for privacy but to be fair we did ask for a quiet room away from The Strand
Positive_Review: Very comfy room with everything one would expect from a good hotel ie water provided robes slippers tea coffee making tray easy to use shower with bath mat already in room usually have to ask Was upgraded to an executive room which was a treat

Negative_Review: Not really that much to do with the hotel itself but there was construction noise in the morning considering the hotel s location that s hardly a surprise Still it s an older building and if You re very sensitive to noises from rooms around You consider bringing ear plugs I didn t find the sounds to be much of a bother but mileages vary
Positive_Review: I loved everything about the Strand Palace maybe that s because I ve never really stayed at a higher class hotel before but from the moment the attendant opened the door and carried our luggage the couple of steps upwards to the lobby I fell in love with the place The lobby is spacious and even with bigger groups of tourists it didn t ever really feel crowded Check in went smoothly and the signs on the walls will help You find Your room quickly We had to wait a short time for breakfast on the first morning outside of the restaurant seating area but I like that better than standing around with a loaded tray hunting for a table and the buffet was really offering pretty much all you could ask for All in all I can really only recomment the Strand Palace Hotel expecially if You re sight seeing and want a lot of the major attractions of London within a bare hour walking distance Btw we had room service on our first night because we were winded from the travel and the food was just awesome

Negative_Review: Bit busy in the peak time e g Morning lifts crowded You can hear the guests in the other rooms but not too much
Positive_Review: Great location lots of rooms Cozy room just as the name small but not cramped just cozy Not spacious but has adequate amount of storage space for 2 3 days Desk space a bit narrow but tolerable Bed comfortable

Negative_Review: Small room Could hear conversation of people in the adjacent room Window which was screwed shut looked out onto courtyard which was a building site with scaffolding and walkways right up to the window Really not value for money
Positive_Review: Convenient venue

Negative_Review: Pillows werent the best One not enough but two was too much and a tad too much traffic noise but I d defo stay again
Positive_Review: Everything staff were very friendly hotel was clean and nicely decorated Perfect location for a theatre show Walking distance to all major tourist points We walked up to Oxford Circus shopping When I stay again I ll check out the Indian restaurant and bar

Negative_Review: It is quite expensive but I guess that is London On the second night I stayed on the 7th floor ceiling was low especially in the shower for a 6 3 man
Positive_Review: Location was great comfortable beds quiet

Negative_Review: evening meal in the carvery was not up to much Food was cold didn t eat much and therefore worked out expensive Would not eat here again
Positive_Review: Location was great room was comfortable staff were helpful and friendly Would stay here again

Negative_Review: My room was windowless which gave me a closed in feeling

Negative_Review: Shower gel had already been opened and part used Service in restaurant at breakfast was inconsistent with no milk jug offered to us but was to others

Negative_Review: The cosy double bedroom was poky and depressing Also no good for twin beds Realised why it was comparatively cheap Big anonymous hotel

Negative_Review: Very tacky outdated hotel located in the center of one of the most touristy areas in London The Covent Garden tube station is within walking distance however is the busiest in the city so beware Not many other tube stations nearby which was somewhat of a hassle If you re looking for a more authentic low key London experience I wouldn t recommend staying here

Negative_Review: Far too expensives for what you get Room is small and the bath system is old school and horrible There s some renovation right now so we didn t open the windows as the view on men at works during the day and the views on the construction at night is not very nice The breakfast is something rella special you have to wait to be seated more than 5 minutes until 10mn but in the same time i saw lot of tables free The breakfast system doesn t works I asked for a hot chocolate i received hot water with chocolate I didn t know London was in war with someone

Negative_Review: The room was tiny Smallest I ve seen outside of Japan But it was fine for our purposes as we didn t spend a lot of time there The TV was at a right angle to the bed and impossible to watch from the bed as there was a gap of about a foot between the bed and the wall so you couldn t even sit on it sideways to watch to comfortably
Positive_Review: The location is really excellent particularly for theatre goers The breakfast is really extensive but expensive at 18 95pp We had ours included in the booking so we used it but I highly doubt we would have paid that for what we ate

Negative_Review: Being on my own I found it a bit annoying that when I went to get something else from the buffet staff had cleared my table for someone else This happened on two occasions Also the tables weren t wiped after use

Negative_Review: Bed bedroom were very small narrow so there was only room to walk on one side of the bed the other was a wall That is a pain for the one next to the wall trying to get out of bed during the night Bed was uncomfortable pillows too hard

Negative_Review: We took 2 rooms and we asked in advanced that the rooms will be next to each other But the stuff didn t do any effort to help Second the Hotel is very old in furniture Windows are not isolated so you hear the noise from the street the wood in the rooms is old and you can see that no renovation was done in the last years

Negative_Review: The room we were originally offered had a view onto another wall and had scaffolding outside with workmen banging etc We asked to be moved and they offered us the only other executive double which was better You would think the better rooms would not look out onto a wall We ate prior to going to the theatre It took 45 minutes to come and was pretty awful in quality

Positive_Review: The breakfast was good and room was lovely

Negative_Review: the single room i had was just too small could be slightly bigger not much space to move around in and small closet space also bathroom very small
Positive_Review: its the ideal location for my work and its a respectable size of a hotel its a very good value for money

Negative_Review: Could do with more normal tea bags in room and a couple more milks Coffee drinkers are spoilt for choice
Positive_Review: Room was larger than last one I stayed in there and didn t expect bathrobes and slippers Nice surprise Great being able to leave luggage on departure so we could enjoy the morning in London before our train home

Negative_Review: our room was at athe darkness bacyard structural framework everywhere and very noisy from early in the morning in fact I would pleased a street side room during the booking crowded hotel

Negative_Review: The room was awful I expected a lot from a 4 star hotel but my room certainly wasn t 4 star the bathroom was very worn with scratches in the sink and a shower which was very old and the plastic knob was broken and had a chunk of it missing and when you had a shower the bath would fill up with water so you couldn t be in there for to long the room just looked so worn and old the windows was very dirty and the view we had was dirty and disgusting All I wanted was to stay in a 4 star hotel room but I would of been better of booking a 2 star hotel just so I would of known what I was in for

Negative_Review: Staff at breakfast took ages to seat us and didn t explain that they were getting our table ready for us just ignored us standing to be seated Door in bathroom looked like it needed repairing and floor tile grout could be doing with cleaning Also a unit could be placed next to the TV in the bedroom to give more storage space as the wardrobe was full of towels hair dryer fan iron and ironing board Only a few coat hangers in the wardrobe Pay 1 for ice cubes which melted within an hour
Positive_Review: The breakfast was good in the Executive dining room Good size bedroom Centrally sited Staff eager to please and very helpful Gym and Wifi free

Negative_Review: Room 915 had noisy air conditioning unit buzzing intermittent noisy radiator humming and knocking from air lock a maintenance guy came to fix problem but failed and problem re occurred in middle of night Shower hose spilt so diabolical shower Staff not interested in hearing whether we had a good stay If you re expecting luxury in the rooms you ll be disappointed Very basic hotel chain like decor
Positive_Review: Location excellent

Negative_Review: The walls are paper thin Could hear neighbour using toilet coughing and watching television at 3 in morning There are hundreds of rooms and therefore SO many people at hotel Wait for breakfast wait for check in and no room at bar in evening Not a great place for me as got very little sleep and I needed sleep to be prepared for my conference
Positive_Review: The location is very convenient The lounges are nice in the evening

Negative_Review: Croissants were dry and the orange and apple juices were awful didn t taste remotely like the fruit they were supposed to Stuck to water as I don t drink tea or coffee but good selection of food available
Positive_Review: Booked a cosy single room but it had everything I needed Good clean bathroom Slept very well for the two nights I stayed

Negative_Review: The room was very small and cramped The bed very uncomfortable and pushed up against the wall This room should be single only A dirty plate with left over breakfast there on lay outside our room from check in till the next afternoon Disgusting
Positive_Review: The location is excellent

Negative_Review: Early check in was 20 Most other hotels would check you in for free if a room was available
Positive_Review: Good breakfast selection fry up cereal fruit and pancakes

Negative_Review: I would have liked a week not just a day
Positive_Review: Superb all round Wooden sliding shutters gave perfect darkness for sleep Bed amazingly comfortable Shower hot and powerful Staff very helpful Breakfast is help yourself and tasty Location perfect for Covent Garden opera house market shops and eateries by the score

Negative_Review: Unfortunately my daughter suffers with claustrophobia so she found the breakfast tables rather tight but the staff soon addressed it
Positive_Review: We were very impressed with the hotel Staff were attentive Nothing too much trouble for them even in breakfast my daughter who suffers with claustrophobia the staff found us a different table

Negative_Review: No Daught beer at the 2 bars There is a sports bar on the corner of the hotel and you can book drinks to your room but not conducive to a relaxing drink returning to the hotel late

Negative_Review: The attitude of the barman in the Gin Palace
Positive_Review: smallish bedroom but well appointed and comfortable beds Location excellent on the Strand so 5 minutes into Covent Garden 5 minutes to the embankment and the Thames 5 minutes to Trafalgar square

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Quiet comfortable room with great size bed and comfy firm mattress The hotel has a great central location by Covent Garden and is easy to get around from by bus tube and taxi Plenty of great places to eat nearby

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: Location great Pleased we did not book a cosy room as the standard were not big Breakfast was good and value for money when paid for on booking in

Negative_Review: We have stayed here several times and this time enjoyed a room up grade Service and cleanliness were fine as usual and the central location is ideal for visiting The only difficulties were the usual ones 1 breakfast can mean either a wait to get into the dining area or a walk in crocodile formation round to the adjacent restaurant 2 like most large hotels you won t get hot breakfast food unless you are very lucky as at best the food will be lukewarm
Positive_Review: Accessibility speed of check in check out

Negative_Review: Not much shelf space in the bathroom If hotels are serious about wanting guests to re use towels then there needs to be enough decent towel rail space to hang them on

Negative_Review: Tiniest of rooms bed against wall on one side so to get out had to clamber over partner Very unsatisfactory loads of restaurants nearby
Positive_Review: Fantastic location

Negative_Review: No warning sign for step outside door when no doorman present I fell flat on my face Poor selection of cereals at breakfast no muesli or granola terrible coffee
Positive_Review: Very convenient location

Negative_Review: The price of drinks in the bars was extortionate 14 00 for a gin and tonic and 5 60 for an insipid cappuccino all this does is make you look elsewhere when if the prices were realistic we would have used the bars more instead we drank in other places

Negative_Review: Scaffolding in the inner courtyard blocked out all light in my room but that is the first time in many years that has happened and is unavoidable when building work is done
Positive_Review: This is an excellent hotel great location and the best smelling lobby in London

Negative_Review: The cosy room was a little smaller than anticipated although was perfectly adequate for a 2 night stay Main gripe was the building work going on adjacent to our window This made for a very noisy early morning

Negative_Review: Bedroom bit small but for one night was ok
Positive_Review: Breakfast very good choices Room bit small bathroom very nice Quick checkout Excellent position for anywhere in London

Negative_Review: My daughters were in an outside room which was very noisy The check in process is shocking when we arrived the queue was enormous which is awful for tourists and UK residents alike When I requested more staff I was talked to quite rudely being told I could have checked in online if I had booked with the hotel direct which would have cost more Funnily enough once I had returned to the queue miraculously some more staff arrived
Positive_Review: The domestic staff were great the room was on an inside courtyard no view but very quiet the location is excellent especially if you are arriving at Waterloo Station The fish tank is great

Negative_Review: Very little natural light in the room with no view except scaffolding see photo attached Would have appreciated being told of this before I arrived

Negative_Review: Bathroom taps lack of Marmite for toasts at breakfast fixed shower rose
Positive_Review: Location staff facilities such as luggage storage cocktails shutters instead of curtains

Positive_Review: The location is excellent as are comfort and cleanliness Breakfast was also very good

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The Strand Palace is a really lovely hotel with friendly and professional staff that were more than helpful The location was great being situated so close to Covent garden The room was clean and all facilities were perfect The breakfast in the hotel was really tasty Also the meal in the Dawaat Indian restaurant in the hotel served the best Indian food that I have ever tasted I couldn t be happier with my stay and highly recommend staying here

Negative_Review: Paid for a standard double room was given a basic until complained Requested front of hotel room overlooking street was given initially a back of hotel Bathroom outdated Service in bar was poor especially considering the pricing Noise outside room in early morning is very loud
Positive_Review: Bed was comfortable the location door staff friendly room was cleaned very well bottled water in room

Negative_Review: The coffee shop which is part of the hotel at the front They took my order I paid and then they told me they had no tables I would have to share one with someone else I asked for a refund which took nearly 15 mins or 8 The manager was so rude and deliberately took her time Don t go there
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: Single room quite small Bathroom facilities not the newest but clean and functioning fine
Positive_Review: Fantastic location very close to Trafalgar square Reception staff very professional Room booked for a fair price only a week before the trip

Negative_Review: no window no daylight there was a window but due to construction work outside it was covered felt like a prison cell

Negative_Review: The Gin Palace was not open on the Sunday
Positive_Review: The bed was amazingly huge and comfortable the Sunday carvery is superb the room was clean and spacious and the staff were lovely

Positive_Review: Great location great convenience generally good breakfast

Negative_Review: Rooms were cozy euphemism for cramped bad bed causing us back pains The bed was tiny and getting in was a chore

Negative_Review: Nothing serious here but I was there for four nights and breakfast are exactly the same every day
Positive_Review: Location is super Staff is helpful The history of the hotel is expectational

Positive_Review: Excellent location Most of the staff were lovely Room was clean Nice reception and bar area and good standard of food drinks

Negative_Review: A cosy double was too small including the bathroom Was fine for one person travelling for business and staying for only 2 nights however for 2 people it would have been cramped

Negative_Review: Breakfast may be because is English breakfast only
Positive_Review: The localization Near everything underground convent garden Trafalgar Square picadily circus Chinatown soho London eye

Negative_Review: Booked a twin got a small double bed up against the wall no bedside table window did not open noisy neighbours unti 1 30 am

Negative_Review: The most disgusting treatment by reception staff Despite being surely making a reservation in advance my colleague was kicked out to another hotel as the reservation for him was canceled by booking com this is not true Moreover a cancellation fee was charged by the reason that my colleague was not arrived on the day After that we protested but the hotel does not accept their mistakes they only explained various contradictory reasons
Positive_Review: good access

Negative_Review: The room is a little bit smaller as compared to some other hotels but generally everything is great and the house keeping services are excellent
Positive_Review: The hotel is clean and the location is great as it is right in the city centre of London

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Reception staffer Stephen was a pleasure Housekeeping and concierge also lovely The bar team in the Gin Palace whilst efficient were not at all engaging Didn t detract from my overall experience though Internet in room was super fast Loved the midday checkout so practical And unlike the last time I stayed this trip I had a room right away from the Stand road and it was blissfully quiet room 916 newly renovated lovely

Negative_Review: I could have had a cheaper deal if I had booked direct

Negative_Review: I thought the bathroom in the room was In need of upgrading

Negative_Review: Staff were miserable and un proffessional A concierge that opens doors whilst on his phone and then let s it shut on you is not a good advert Rooms need updating especially the bathroom
