Positive_Review: All staff were friendly and hotel lovely Great location for theatres Large selection of breakfast food

Negative_Review: I do not know why when I book offers for this hotel via booking Com they always give me a problematic rooms noisy cold with much noise from the radiator My staying there was a nightmare I could not sleep well because of the strong noise Last time the same Are we b class customers buying discounted rooms If so do not book using booking com I am fed up with this hypocrite strategy from hotel and from booking com maybe
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: the bed was very uncomfortable and so were the pillows i was very cold and had t ask for extra covers
Positive_Review: the location was the best aspect to this hotel but i wouldn t stay again for the money

Negative_Review: I found my executive room very cramped There was very little space between my bed and my suitcase and the end of the bed and the desk I was however grateful for the window looking onto the street outside That helped to alleviate the claustrophobic feeling
Positive_Review: The bed was very comfortable The maid in charge when i first arrived brought me more coffee and made sure I had what I needed The room was equipped with everything that I had previously experienced in a larger one when travelling with my late husband The shower room was big in comparison with with narrowness of the bedroom Concierge service was excellent also help with baggage

Negative_Review: We had to queue for about half an hour to check in because of a group were checking in ahead of us Eventually another member of reception staff came out who helped book us in quickly after that Rooms are lovely and comfortable but the walls are a bit thin We could hear what was going on in next door s bathroom
Positive_Review: Great location we could leave our luggage there for a few hours before catching our train very nice decor and layout Daawat Indian restaurant downstairs was great All staff were very helpful and welcoming

Negative_Review: Upgraded from cosy double to standard and that was small When there were a lot of guests breakfast looked tired as wasn t replenished enough It was fine when not so busy
Positive_Review: Excellent location for opera theatres and galleries Walking distance for most of these Staff very friendly and helpful

Negative_Review: The staff were came across as literally there to do a job The whole building feels dated I went to my room after a late check in unpacked got ready for bed and then noticed the window was not locked and easily lifted open and there was an adjacent window that I considered accessible The room was also cold as there was no heating other than a small plug in radiator that was giving off a bad smell There was no forewarning of either issue and when I called to swap rooms and suffer the inconvenience of having to re pack and get dressed again this was not an option A suggestion of sending up a maintenance man was put to me but it had already gone 2300 hrs I was a lone female and there was no guarantee of when he would turn up so I hardly slept a wink and am still out of sorts as a result ever since Will not be going back again
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: As above
Positive_Review: Excellent location Comfortable stay I stayed in a standard twin Comfortable clean and functional but didn t feel special There was no bath the lights were very dim which made the room look a bit gloomy and there was no complimentary hot chocolate Perfectly adequate for staying for business reasons but I wouldn t have booked this place for a romantic trip away The best thing about this hotel is the gentleman who helped us with our baggage in the lobby He was very friendly helpful and approachable

Negative_Review: Absolutely nothing
Positive_Review: A special thanks to Mohamed and the rest of the staff for helping us stay in the Strand Hotel during our unfortunate foggy New Year We appreciate people who think outside the box Every year we come to the Strand Hotel between Christmas and New Year and we will keep on coming

Negative_Review: Hoovering the halls at the crack of dawn ruined my lay in
Positive_Review: Firm mattress good sized room good staff fast checking and out good concierge pretty central location cant complain

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: We were really impressed with the central location the hotel itself was really pleasant with a pleasant atmosphere from the staff The rooms themselves were quite basic but they were really clean and the beds were really comfy The shower was really good too Would definitely recommend this hotel and will come come back again Didn t have breakfast so can t comment

Negative_Review: The room and double bed where very small for 2 of us that are on the short side anyone over 6ft would struggle with the short bed in particular Breakfast was just very average and not hot at all plus we where all sqeezed in to a small area with tiny tables
Positive_Review: The location was brilliant for what we wanted and the doormen first class

Negative_Review: I haven t found one thing to be unhappy about
Positive_Review: The hotel and the staff were very helpful Also their vast size allowed them to get you better service for extras Including money exchange and tickets for shows

Negative_Review: The wifi didn t work for me not sure why Didn t really need it anyway
Positive_Review: We chose this hotel for it s location It is just a VERY short walk to the Aldwych Theatre and the musical Beautiful No need for a Taxi and also there are plenty of places nearby to get a meal before the show started

Negative_Review: Lack of room climate control fridge and in our last stay an extremely small room Drinks v expensive but typical London
Positive_Review: Staff excellent and location for us perfect Excellent restaurants and bars

Negative_Review: We made a point of letting the hotel know at the time of booking we were celebrating my wife s 50th birthday We asked when checking in if we had a room with some sort of view and were told no and we are not moving you Were disappointed there was nothing in the room when we checked in but after after some lunch and a walk we arrived back to find a card and bottle of processco had been left Thank you We would definitely book the Strand Palace again but would make sure we had a nicer room
Positive_Review: We asked for 2 rooms to be near to each other and on the same floor We also asked for a high floor Both request were done with no fuss

Negative_Review: No frig or air con in room Breakfast average poor cereals no muesli or granular mushrooms black pudding below par
Positive_Review: Room was quiet and a good sleep both nights Good ambience in communal areas Location of hotel great for shows shops Covent Garden

Negative_Review: Rooms are quite small
Positive_Review: The location of hotel was super within walking distant of all amenities We were upgraded to a standard room on 7th floor nice touch

Negative_Review: Replace shower curtain
Positive_Review: The location is perfect Staff were friendly and helpful Good food and good variety Choice of bars Especially enjoyed the cocktail bar

Negative_Review: We were staying in room 277 and the bathroom was extremely cold No radiator or heated towel rail You could feel the draught through the closed windows But fortunately it was only for one night
Positive_Review: Swift and efficient check in and check out Free room upgrade

Negative_Review: Stayed three nights on two of the nights we were woken by noisy guests Cleaner on the morning of our departure arrived at 8 30 and asked us if she could clean we still had plenty of time before checkout
Positive_Review: Great location Excellent selection of places to eat near by

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The hotel staff responded brilliantly to deal with long queues opening up an area of the restaurant for breakfast not normally used to reduce waiting time Again at check out a member of reception queue walked to clear people simply waiting to hand in key cards and leave All done with good humor to great effect

Negative_Review: Two towels rather than just the one please
Positive_Review: The friendly accommodating staff and location of the hotel makes it more that 5 stars The lovely gesture with the room and champagne made our 30th wedding anniversary weekend really special We will stay nowhere else when in London

Negative_Review: Tea and coffee at breakfast was always made with not hot enough water and had to be sent back Small issues that shouldn t have been spoilt the two days Have commente to the hotel direct
Positive_Review: Bed was excellent

Negative_Review: First room offered right next to noisy ventilation duct Changed immediately without any fuss by receptionist Copious buffet breakfast lacked finesse inevitable I suppose with mass catering
Positive_Review: Great location close to Covent Garden and theatre land Room small but adequate for a short stay

Negative_Review: Bathroom was dirty with ladies hairs on the floor Room and bathroom freezing even though heating was on Noisy due to outside ventilator Speak to the manager but was wasting my time
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: We were in the executive dining room for breakfast which was a little dowdy The breakfast was satisfactory but could have been better The other dining room looked much brighter I asked at approx 8am in the morning for some milk to enable us to have a cup of tea in the room and reception said they would get house keeping to send it Nothing came by the time we left at about 11am
Positive_Review: The reception staff on our arrival were very good and the gentleman who welcomed at the door was extremely helpful and very pleasant to chat to We were upgraded to an executive room thank you very much

Negative_Review: Mattress was to hard for our liking Some food items at breakfast could have been hotter
Positive_Review: Ambience of hotel Helpfulness of staff Cleanliness of rooms Location of hotel

Negative_Review: Room a little small with hard mattress and rather poor quality fittings etc This is budget not luxury
Positive_Review: Value hotel in central location Good carvery and good breakfast Good free wifi Very pleasant staff

Negative_Review: I booked a single cozy room which was absolutely perfect for one traveler but the bed was very uncomfortable I also don t think the cleaning crew changed the sheets during my week long stay there were several stains on them
Positive_Review: The location just can t be beat So close to everything The hotel is beautiful and all the staff is wonderful I had a quick lunch is The Lounge one day and it was delicious

Negative_Review: I did not like the look of the eggs or the bacon so didn t eat these I wish you had the little individual pots of Marmite
Positive_Review: The room was very comfy and the staff were very polite I have been before on business which is why I came back

Negative_Review: I got frustrated trying to get wi fi connection Could not find the radio on the remote control
Positive_Review: The bed The piping hot water Very close to RCJ where i was working Pleasantly comfortable bedroom temperature

Negative_Review: Room slightly small
Positive_Review: Plenty of staff in every department Quick service in bar for food and drink Plenty of room in foyer area Buffet breakfast quality excellent and very efficiently presented

Negative_Review: Could have been a handwash in the bathroom not just soap or shower stuff
Positive_Review: We upgraded to a standard double for an extra 10 at the suggestion of the receptionist who booked us in when she explained that the cosy double would have been right up against one wall so difficult for one person to get out of bed without disturbing the other

Negative_Review: Breakfast more reasonable priced which is why I opted out
Positive_Review: Very helpful and friendly staff especially Mitko and and older door man who was in afternoon evening

Negative_Review: Our bathroom was freezing we had a faulty electrical socket and our breakfasts on Sunday were appalling
Positive_Review: Staff friendly and courteous and the main areas of the hotel were warm and very comfortable

Negative_Review: My only slight criticsm was that my room was a little to hot and there was no thermostat and was unable to open windows To cool the room I kep the door to the bathroom open
Positive_Review: Cleanliness check in receptionist was very welcoming and polite

Negative_Review: I would never stay here again We were not able to check in for several hours as the computers were down The lobby was cold and full of very unhappy guests It was January and the heating in the room did not work but the staff did not inform us of this upon check in We requested a room change but were told we could not because of the special booking price A tiny portable heater was provided which made no difference The duvets were paper thin more for summer than winter No chance we would ever be confortable in the cold dreary room We requested to cancel our booking so we could find a more suitable hotel The hotel said we must call Booking com They said only the hotel could refund our money I offered a compromise and pay for one night of a two night booking The manager refused So we left the hotel with our bags on a cold rainy day and found a decent place to stay 430 wasted They can keep my money I will keep my dignity
Positive_Review: Absolutely Nothing

Negative_Review: Rooms small and very dated Paying for the name and location clearly Bar too small with insufficient seating Gin bar service was very slow
Positive_Review: Restaurant Staff were friendly and efficient Communal areas were reasonable Proximity to Covent Garden Theatres and attractions is good

Negative_Review: Hotel was a bit tired looking and the bathroom was in desperate need of modernization Hotel and Gin Palace were a bit lacking in atmosphere Hotel is perfectly adequate but I think with a bit more effort it could be very special Not sure if I care for shutters instead of curtains in the bedroom That s possibly just a personal preference
Positive_Review: Location was excellent Bed was large clean and comfortable Tea making facilities were good and bathroom toiletries also good Reception staff very nice For the location we would go back but I would ask if they have a room that has been refurbished if possible

Negative_Review: We had a room with a particularly noisy shower air in the pipes and a radiator that was broken However staff were apologetic and helpful
Positive_Review: Excellent facilities in a truly fantastic location Hotel interior although dated was beautifully clean Staff generally helpful and polite

Negative_Review: The breakfast tables were very small we like our space and with coffee and tea pots side plates and main plates it was all too cramped
Positive_Review: John at Reception was brilliant and gave us a warm welcome

Negative_Review: The bed The shower Not up to hotel standard I am afraid The mattress was lumpy and was starting to collapse Lets put it this way it wouldn t pass as a guest bed in any ones house The shower was fine if you were under 5 ft I am 6ft4 and my head was against the ceiling pressed against a down lighter with water spraying every where Not great is an understatement
Positive_Review: location and staff very good

Negative_Review: I did not eally like the bed based up against the wall and I did say I was worried about the chair not been safe
Positive_Review: The whole weekend was great the breakfast was spot on although the pre flask of tea did taste stewed

Negative_Review: Our room was small and cramped Hotel could do with some redecorating as it is looking quite shabby in places but it is good value for money for such a central location
Positive_Review: Amazing location in the heart of London easy access from here to all parts

Negative_Review: Shower needed some getting used to and one day with low pressure Other than that which in the end didn t bother much our stay was very nice
Positive_Review: Great location comfortable bed rooms were noise free Good concierge service and tips Many nice visit and food options at walking distance

Negative_Review: Small room uncomfortable and small bed but as I say it is a central London hotel and you get what you pay for
Positive_Review: Location A central London hotel at a realistic price

Negative_Review: The service in the Resturant is poor We had to wait every morning in a que to be seated as not enough space and moved to a different Resturant on one morning because of lack of space In the second Resturant there was no white sugar on the table as all had been used We are tea drinkers and would not use brown sugar When I asked the waitress for whit sugar she informed me they had run out of it I couldn t believe my ears A hotel Resturant running g out of white sugar eat 8 20 in the morning She eventually went to another table and return with two packets of sugar The breakfast staff certainly could do with more training We had to request them to bring us tea Any other hotel we ever stayed in the staff always came and asked if we need tea coffee and if everything was ok Not here Makes a difference to the guest even if the food wasn t great it makes one feel welcome and the guest then overlooks some shortcomings in a forgiving manner We pay for good service and we work hard to be able to travel and enjoy The staff in reception and especially the Concierge Steven was lovely and we had a good laugh with him
Positive_Review: Cooked breakfast was not appealing to the eye Eggs definitely wouldn t touch and I like eggs Rashers where tough hard to the bite Only tried this once and not all

Negative_Review: Gym was not easy to find but not really time to use it anyway
Positive_Review: Temperature was easily controllable with simple radiator control and opening window Easy walking distance for plenty of attractions beat the tube strike Plentiful and varied breakfast

Negative_Review: No sound proofing in rooms bring ear plugs To check in and out there s a massive queue At breakfast you re asked if you d like a tea or coffee then you ask for a cappuccino and they tell you you ll be charged The room was cold and there s no mini bar Overall I would avoid this hotel
Positive_Review: Location hash browns were delicious 12pm check out time

Negative_Review: Extremely small cosy room Bed could only be accessed from one side Moved to next level Small but workable
Positive_Review: Room problem dealt with promptly Good breakfast

Negative_Review: The room was dated and shabby as I work In the city the location although wonderful for theatre goers wasn t really an asset for me I found it very commercial and although the staff were friendly enough I found other guests totally miserable barely able to utter a good morning And funnily enough I haven t experienced that at other hotels in London I wouldn t stay here again not a nice feel The room service food was average presentation rubbish the poor man seemed overworked to say the least
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: The synthetic pillows were like bricks I had a sore neck by the morning
Positive_Review: The room was small but clean and convenient and remarkably quiet considering the central London location

Negative_Review: It was expensive The room was small
Positive_Review: The complimentary bottle given to my brother for his birthday It was un expected The location of the hotel as there was a tube strike on the day The staff were very friendly

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Really happy with our choice massive hotel but incredible well located nice staff good rooms clean in the middle of every attraction tube stations nearby a 10 for us

Negative_Review: Was unable to sleep due to faulty air conditioning unit within the room which staff were unwilling to assist or relocate The manager only got involved upon leaving the hotel and was also was not helpful and only used my negative experience as an attempt to try and get me to pay to stay again Do not stay here
Positive_Review: Looked very nice

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The beds were extremely comfortable We had to ask for face cloths and a light bulb to be replaced but everything else in our room was just what we wanted needed The concierge was extremely helpful in booking theatres and a car to Heathrow

Negative_Review: They didn t like coming home
Positive_Review: Lovely hotel offers ave stayed several times did this a present for my son and partner they loved it especially the breakfast

Negative_Review: The carvery in the hotel was adequate but nothing special especially not for the price Rooms are small and would feel cramped if you were staying for longer than 2 or 3 nights
Positive_Review: The wifi was excellent The room was small but perfectly formed Large walk in a shower with a powerful shower and very hot water something you don t always get in London hotels Very clean room and excellent housekeeping Tea coffee biscuits and water each day a nice touch often being cut out else where Great location in easy walking distance of different aspects of London theatre shopping sightseeing

Negative_Review: We were a little shocked to find the bar very expensive we spent 20 on two baileys liqueurs which we thought more than necessary
Positive_Review: General all round efficiency everything we needed for a relaxing weekend

Negative_Review: Cold rooms but could turn up heat myself except from the bathroom A bit crowdy for breakfast with lines for waiting but when finally there the breakfast is nice
Positive_Review: Enjoyed the area and closeness to everything specially for us and the theatres close by and the good shopping in Covent Garden Spacy single room

Negative_Review: The hotel states 4 star but service and facilities more 3 star Had booked Executive Double however the room was not good very dark and tiny window faced a wall and constant hum from hotels air con units The room next door had Executive label whereas our room did not making me wonder if they had added a coffee maker to a standard double as hotel was full It did not match images of executive room I complained and was told no other executive doubles available and got the feeling that this was because I had booked via Bookings com rather than hotel direct It took 45 minutes to get an alternative room a standard not executive double which was better as faced front of hotel this confirmed my feelings about the executive double room they gave me being a re labelled standard room because they were full I then had to argue for a refund on difference in room price waiting to have it credited back and benefits of executive room booking all disappeared once I moved rooms no record of me on breakfast list tried to charge for newspaper and no 10 discount which was supposed to be applied on food drink in hotel
Positive_Review: Location excellent for theatres and food at hotel good generally clean if standard for any hotel

Negative_Review: I was happy with everything there was nothing in particular that would warrant a negative comment at this point
Positive_Review: The overall presentation from reception area to the room was very inviting and nice

Negative_Review: Checking in at reception was a very slow process especially if you arrive before your room was ready Others were queueing because their room wasnt ready at 2pm Our teenage daughter was with us in a separate room and we had pre asked for her room to be close which they ignored but changed when asked again
Positive_Review: Convenient value for money was quiet despite being very busy Breakfast was good value too Rooms were clean and functional no bath in double or kingsize room though showers were good

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Excellent location and the quietest hotel I ve ever stayed in while in central London Absolutely no traffic noise whatsoever it was worth requesting an upper floor quiet room while booking

Negative_Review: Small rooms and comfort for the money smaller bed and very hard madress Not fully soundproof rooms so some noice in the evening and morning when cleaning rooms next door
Positive_Review: Very welcome and PERFECT location in London Overall a Good Stay

Negative_Review: Nothing the staff can do about it but it is a maze to get from the elevator to the room
Positive_Review: The bed was super comfy Location was nice right across the street from The Savoy

Negative_Review: For our short stay not much We were very pleased
Positive_Review: Stayed there about 10 years ago and saw a marked improvement in service staff friendliness room cleanliness and overall ambiance of the property

Negative_Review: The only breakfast I had over the 3 days was luke warm and had been standing on a warm plate for too long The bed was a little too hard for my liking
Positive_Review: Excellent location facilities and very helpful staff

Negative_Review: Some rooms were pretty loud as I heard a lot of complaints from other occupants in the hotel Our room faced the main road which is loud however once you shut the wooden blinds the noise virtually disappears Plus the wooden blinds allow for the room to become very dark which makes it easy to sleep in late
Positive_Review: Perfect location Couldn t be any better

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Lovely room with a great view Staff very helpful and friendly We checked in and were shown straight to our room despite being early A fabulous overnight stay

Negative_Review: Might just be the smallest room I ve ever occupied Wasn t big enough to actually put the bed where you could get into it from either side
Positive_Review: Location on the Strand is right in the middle of downtown

Negative_Review: You need to warn on your web sight that two adults can not sleep in a single bed located up tight to the wall I write travel stories for a South Florida res publication and I shall warn them of this problem
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: How the staff are warm and welcoming make you feel at at home and in safe hands How clean the rooms and comfortable they are spaces with a well suited bathroom

Negative_Review: Bathroom was a bit cold very basic heating in the room Plugin oil filled radiator
Positive_Review: Exec room was very good size breakfast was top quality Room was comfortable and staff all very friendly Ask for quite room got exactly that no street noise

Negative_Review: The room was a little small but it was in london so it was about what I could expect
Positive_Review: For the price it was a very enjoyable room Right near all the tourist attractions it was very easy to just go and see thing without having to go far

Negative_Review: Noise from pipes was very loud Plumbing needs looking at
Positive_Review: Complimentary bottle of Prosecco as we arrived Xmas eve Lovely touch Very attentive staff room service staff were lovely as were the restaurant staff Fabulous location

Negative_Review: The extract fan in the bathroom was ineffective causing the water to condense on the walls then run down creating a large pool on the floor thereby causing a slip hazard The view was of a dark internal courtyard overlooking the loud air conditioning units The queue to check in was too slow it took 30 minutes before being served only to be told my room wasn t ready and to return later to collect my key even though it was nearly 15 00 I went for breakfast to be told by a staff member the restaurant was full and I should go to the other one I then spotted a colleague in the same restaurant and entered only to find the restaurant over half empty and not full at all
Positive_Review: The bed was OK The room was clean and functional

Negative_Review: Terrible bathroom a almost 1 step up into the shower with a metal tract for the shower door My mother slipped on the wet floor and has a terrible cut on her leg that will need an operation we had to ask for extra no slip mats
Positive_Review: Great location

Negative_Review: On this occasion as it was NYE and I was staying with a friend who had a separate room at the Strand I stayed in a single room for 170 which is over priced when it s usually 120 for a double Never the less I couldn t fault the hotel at all
Positive_Review: Everything at The Strand is perfect I always stay there when in London as the location is fantastic and the staff are wonderful

Negative_Review: The only thing that put me off a little was the price I d say I stayed during NYE
Positive_Review: I didn t use the any of the hotel facilities bar gym etc but room facilities were all working kettle haitdryer shower nespresso machine was definitely the best nespresso machine s are only in the executive rooms only room size was really good I m a short person there s a vending machine on each floor by the lift so very handy indeed staff was extremely friendly and helpful other than all that I enjoyed my stay

Negative_Review: I was staying in a single room which I considered to be quite small Overall the hotel was a little old looking and could benefit from a refreshment
Positive_Review: Location location location Ideally situated for those who like to wander around Trafalgar Square or Covent Garden are only a few minutes walk away and easy access to soho For longer distances the area is very well connect through the tube line The personnel was very kind and helpful

Negative_Review: Disabled facilities bedroom not specifically requested spacious but unable to relax in bath owing to position of handrails Also flush handle on loo very loose to the point of looking like it was about to come off
Positive_Review: Express check out

Negative_Review: First room was poorly cleaned but we got a new room directly Also very small beds with a cold wall on one side in the cosy rooms The shower cabinet did not fit a 190cm person or above
Positive_Review: Breakfast service minded personnel location

Negative_Review: Housekeeping knocking on the door each morning and then room not done before 3 30 pm One room had a flooded bathroom on arrival so one of us had to move downstairs
Positive_Review: Central location for Thetres and shops and landmarks

Negative_Review: kingsize room was small no bath tiny bathroom overpriced for room overlooking side street very noisey
Positive_Review: location staff wooden shutters for windows to black out street lights ease of check out

Negative_Review: Most of the restaurant staff didn t seem happy especially at the breakfast sittings On the first morning when asked if we would like tea or coffee before I could answer the waitress had walked off so I ended up with tea
Positive_Review: Very good location

Negative_Review: Arriving to find they had over booked the hotel and promptly pushed into a small cold room Attitude of checking in person poor which seemed to flow up to the manager
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: I had a room with window towards The Strand Heavy traffic and a lot of noise I think for this category of hotel I would expect sound insulating windows on this side of the building
Positive_Review: Excellent english breakfast

Negative_Review: The bed was saggy and uncomfortable the Gin Palace was never open and the restaurant felt like a canteen Not what I expected for 90
Positive_Review: The shower was good and I liked the wooden window shutters

Negative_Review: A bit of renovation was needed overall
Positive_Review: Breakfast was good with plenty of choice The location is good and walking distance to Coventry Garden and tube stations

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: For a North American the room and the bed were just too small It was on an inner courtyard so quiet which was a plus And good value for London Staff were good and everything was clean

Negative_Review: There were no bed tables in the room and one of the beds was placed close to the wall The room in need of talc
Positive_Review: The location Perfect for shopping and tourist attractions

Negative_Review: Booking said there was an airport shuttle but there wasn t The room was tiny Neighbouring rooms were exptremely noisy Bathroom vent looked like it had mould on it
Positive_Review: Great place to stay for theatre access

Negative_Review: Wish the gym stayed open later no biggie
Positive_Review: Everything Ease of check in and out Room was comfortable and had everything I needed down to bathrobe iron nespresso and free wifi Breakfast was excellent service from staff throughout the building is exceptional Location is awesome close to everything

Negative_Review: To say the room was Executive and the small window looked out onto blank walls was poor The room was quite stark but adequate for the time we spent there
Positive_Review: The breakfast was quite good

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The hotel is centrally located which provided easy access to just about everywhere The staff we came in contact with were warm and welcoming and readily assisted with every question etc we had The concierge was very helpful in suggesting events and procuring tickets

Negative_Review: My room was located in the first floor just above one of the restaurants in the hotel and the smell of meat cooking was really quite strong I didn t mind to much but if you want to avoid that I suggest a room higher up
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Room had no drawers for clothes and was quiet small and because we didn t book direct we didn t receive a 15 voucher and a bottle of prosecco which we had when we stayed before
Positive_Review: Excellent location pleasant staff always clean very quiet bottled water in room

Negative_Review: Our room was 349 and we were wakened every morning very early due to noise of deliveries below one morning 4 30am to what sounded like empty bottles being put in to recycling lorry not impressed as were on a break and wanted a longer sleep in due to the noise this was not to be it would need to be another layer of glass on Windows to make it better sound proof our bathroom floor was also very tired like and needs a bit of attention
Positive_Review: The location for the theatres is fantastic Charing Cross underground very close

Negative_Review: Room very basic with little comfort Very cold with a chilly draught from the window Dark room with a gloomy atmosphere R
Positive_Review: Excellent location within walking distance of many main attractions

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: The location of this property is PERFECT so close to Covent Garden theatre land etc If you re planning a weekend don t bother looking at any other hotel It is that good

Negative_Review: Noise from outside and no air conditioning We had shutters on the windows which we had to use to block out the street lights as on the second floor Felt clostrophobic
Positive_Review: Excellent service nothing was a problem Lovely selection at breakfast and spacious room

Negative_Review: It is pricey but this is London Occasionally you can find a room for under 200 Pounds then its worth it Reception had to print my invoice out 8 times until they finally got it to use my current address and not the old one from 1 year ago
Positive_Review: Location Right behind Covent Garden Comfort Great Hotel Great rooms Very Clean Cleaning staff very helpful

Negative_Review: They over charged me The agreed rate was 165 They required me to pay over 200 So there was some failure of communication between yourselves and the hotel I had not taken the details to London and couldn t remember offhand so I paid the increase The hotel would no doubt say that we had breakfast on top which is correct but only because they told us it was included in the rate
Positive_Review: handy location

Negative_Review: The Breakfast Dinner lounge needs facelifting wooden tables feel a bit sticky although clean
Positive_Review: Great Location Good Breakfast Express Checkout

Negative_Review: Only complaint we had was one morning in breakfast we was told to leave are table when we had only just finished our breakfast while still having drinks
Positive_Review: The bed was very comfy and love the afternoon tea

Negative_Review: Bedding was a bit worn out need to replace pillowcases
Positive_Review: wellcoming entrance to hotel Helpful doormen and polite and friendly Good location for sightseeing tube stations nearby

Negative_Review: I ve stayed in better hostels
Positive_Review: Banging about in the room next door till early hours of the morning beds hard as iron pillows flats and rubbish Front Dorman pour customer relationship desk staff very solemn

Negative_Review: Price for the room is rather high and there s no view to mention or a really large room to make this up But this is London An obvious persistent stain in the further clean sheet shouldn t have been there and the sheet taken out of circulation
Positive_Review: Early arrival but the room was ready very welcome after the flight to London Also we had early departure 3 days later and breakfast was available from 6 30 Good breakfast and polite service from the staff all the time

Negative_Review: Our room was a cosy double small would be a better description The cooked breakfast could have done being a bit hotter
Positive_Review: The location is excellant

Negative_Review: The breakfast staff is overeager to remove glasses from the table When coming early to breakfast it is annoying to be placed at an unsteady table infront of the exit from the street When pointing out the unsteady table the servers solutions was to put something under the leg instead of offering us another table there were las than 10 persons in the restaurant We did get another table when we insisted but we should have had to have the discussion
Positive_Review: Excellent and clean room Excellent service Nicebreakfast Papers and magazines in the lobby Very helpful porters desk

Negative_Review: bar prices 11 70 for a Vodka and coke Would have spent more at reasonable prices
Positive_Review: very clean and comfortable everything I needed great location

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: A small room but very quiet facing inwards to the centre of the building and the windows open Good bathroom comfortable bed Breakfast buffet limited but sufficient Very efficient staff Perfect location for opera theatre and gallery visits

Negative_Review: Requested a quite King room but was given the choice for a noisy king or quiet twins Thank goodness the room bathroom was super clean which helped us to enjoy the room a bit more Great Location as well
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Not enough staff clearing breakfast tables and ditribution tea coffee bit haphazard as a result
Positive_Review: Location friendly staff and excellent breakfast choice

Negative_Review: The room was freezing cold and very noisy In the morning I actually thought someone was either trying to break in or in my wardrobe as the noise which turned out to be coming from next door using their wardrobe was SO LOUD The room was small and ok bathroom a bit shabby and not as clean as I would like The duvet was wafer thin as were the pillows
Positive_Review: Location was excellent for my business in London

Negative_Review: Bed was hard pillows almost non existent The rooms are quite small for the price
Positive_Review: The location was excellent The rooms and common areas were very clean Staff was friendly and helpful

Negative_Review: The bed was a little hard for my liking Breakfast was very busy although handled efficiently
Positive_Review: The location was excellent for Buckingham Palace The Mall Trafalgar Square and the shows The staff were very helpful We were given a free upgrade to a larger room which we gratefully accepted

Negative_Review: The whole hotel needed refurbishment and was dismal The mattress and pillows were like rocks Bedroom walls were thin and other guests were noisy We couldn t sleep The shower had inadequate power We complained and were offered a discount if we stayed again so they did try to make amends but I won t be staying again
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Noisy with no effective sound insulation between rooms or between the room and between the room and corridor Decor is looking pretty tired and everything is slightly worn around the edges
Positive_Review: Very good location nice fast elevators and the room was cleaned well The wooden shutters on the inside of the windows were very effective and the bed was comfortable

Negative_Review: the aircon in the room was not maintaining temperature and kept switching off and on all night so couldnt sleep although the bed was comfortable the breakfast room was dirty and the cooked breakfast wasnt up to standard it s a pity because the location is fantastic
Positive_Review: good location

Negative_Review: The toilet paper was only 2 ply people fold it over and use 4 times the amount with 3 ply people use what they need Also I would like hot chocolate powder to be made with boiling water in the rooms please no one drinks caffeine last thing at night Why don t the bathrooms have an expellair switch They certainly do not work automatically I loved the mens shoes in the GR display but why no prices The sign said 50 off but 50 off what
Positive_Review: I love the Strand Palace Hotel so much atmosphere and personality Breakfast is a feast so much choice so much food The porridge once I d found it down a hole was delicious quite excellent Thank you Mr wonderful Maitre Di for fetching me some honey to go on it Nothing was too much trouble in his restaurant

Negative_Review: The room was nothing like the advert that enticed me to go ahead and book Not sure how it could be charged or called an executive room We would have expected chairs not taking turns to sit on the one available which was really uncomfortable The room was drab again nothing like your advert it was not worth the money at all we would not like to have seen a standard room if this was the quality of Executive The window casement was broken and so the top part of the window kept slipping down safety sign a bit ironic really We would not recommend these rooms to anyone who is planning to spend any time in the hotel better off sitting in the foyer
Positive_Review: The executive breakfast was very good Staff friendly courteous and helpful Really close to all the major sites

Negative_Review: Everything The service facilities staff
Positive_Review: Staff abrupt and not facilitating Rooms cold and dirty 60 min wait for breakfast before being sat down Very dissapointed

Negative_Review: Stayed in December but no heating on in the room which made it a little cold
Positive_Review: Extra large bed very comfy Receptionist was very helpful at check in made us feel very welcome Breakfast superb

Negative_Review: Short wait to get a seat at breakfast We would all like things to be cheaper but the early deals are good value
Positive_Review: Location is excellent for Westend and museums and all transport For the size of it the service seems to be still personal

Negative_Review: Windows need double glazing rather than the totally opaque wooden shutters
Positive_Review: Comfortable clean room and excellent breakfast All staff encountered were friendly and helpful

Negative_Review: Nothing The whole event was great
Positive_Review: It s central position to all the theatres and Covent Garden which is only minutes away There are an amazing number of Bars and restaurants within only a few minutes walk as well

Negative_Review: The interior d cor of the shared areas of the hotel is a little tired and the room d cor was outdated cheap e g bathroom and tatty The biggest problem was noise coming through the paper thin walls and from the corridor too as the door had no seal around it so sound came in easily
Positive_Review: The breakfast was good value for the quality and the Indian restaurant that is part of the hotel was really good The staff were very helpful

Negative_Review: Signs for lift could be more visible on corridor walls not just at immediate turning Bed next to wall not convenient more suited to single travellers
Positive_Review: Breakfast at 12 a head offer excellent value very central and easy to access from Waterloo Not as luxurious as the address suggests but great for the Savoy Theatre and not as expensive as the hotel Thank goodness hotel didn t have air conditioning as I find it difficult to sleep with it on a little more milk and coffee would be appreciated

Negative_Review: There was no view out of our window because they had a brick wall built in front of our window which sucked
Positive_Review: It was just across from the savoy theater which was perfect for me and my mum as we were going to see dreamgirls and we didn t want to travel in london at night The beds were nice and firm

Negative_Review: The room was very small and the bathroom was not the cleanest it could have been It was very expensive but guess you re paying for location rather than comfort
Positive_Review: The location was great and easy

Negative_Review: Room was extremely small for the money and bed was against the wall making it very difficult for that person to get in and out I was marching in the Remembrance Parade and am trying to book again for next year but am told I cannot
Positive_Review: Location and hotel overall

Negative_Review: As a frequent customer there is still a problem with accessing the lifts at peak periods they seem to bypass floors That s why I prefer to stay on lower floors
Positive_Review: Staff at check in were very helpful in finding an alternative room when booked room was not immediately available even at 2 00pm

Negative_Review: Reception staff very slow at check in and out Upgraded our room to one where all night road works were taking place had to change room at 12 30 at night Staff in lounge bar miserable not welcoming or friendly and the coffee was luke warm Overall disgraceful hotel
Positive_Review: Good location and public areas

Negative_Review: The room was very masculine the tap was lose and the glass in the bathroom had mouldy in the bottom for the price the quality was poor but maybe you had to pay more because of the location the drilling outside till 3am was awful but not the hotels fault but the early morning hoovering after the late night was very disturbing I guess they cleaners had to do their job but not slit if sleep for this pricy room
Positive_Review: The location was excellent

Negative_Review: I appreciate that it was a single room but quite cramped possibly too much in there for the size of the room
Positive_Review: Location was brilliant very reasonably priced for the area Hotel facilites were excellent bar prices were very competitive

Negative_Review: Bathroom only has a towel radiator and never really heated up making the room cold when using the bathroom
Positive_Review: The staff were brilliant Very friendly nothing too much trouble Made you feel welcome Location is excellent for getting around London Food in the Carvery very good

Negative_Review: For a 4 star hotel it worthed as 2 or 3 stars and was very outdated The room I got was old and smelly old heating almost no amenities not even a glass to drink water The bath was full of black spots in the joints The guy in the concierge desk throwed me a magazine with a map without a word when I asked for a map really rude No worth the money at all I would not recommend it unless you only care about the location
Positive_Review: Location is perfect and really close to Convent Garden

Negative_Review: Found the receptionist on booking in very condescending and blanked my partner throughout the booking in process Cosy room is just that small and the shower is of no use to anyone over the height of 5 10 simply too low Bed was uncomfortable and small double
Positive_Review: Location was perfect for Westend theatre and Covent Garden Excellent facilities around hotel which is situated directly opposite the Savoy Theatre Dreamgirls is an amazing show Also went to School Of Rock and The Play that Goes Wrong simply hilarious and all within easy walking distance of hotel Very friendly doormen and room service was good value and tasty Covent garden eateries are less than a 3 minute walk away and Maxwells Nachos are a must Great location with friendly staff

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: It s in a perfect location for theatres shopping and Covent Garden The room was spacious comfortable and clean The food was of high quality and presented perfectly

Negative_Review: Check in and out Slow Sometimes see extra staff members wondering around when there s a queue for checking out but bearable Hotel Hotel could be updated Rooms nice and warm because of shutters Emergency vending machines selling essentials and snacks
Positive_Review: Great location Organic toiletries regularly topped up Reasonable selection of food but better outdoors Something for everyone here

Negative_Review: It was very dusty and generally didn t feel very clean The bed was just OK and the sofa bed was terrible The temperature in the room was hard to control due to there only being a radiator which was quite filthy
Positive_Review: Loved the location and we had quick responses to housekeeping requests

Negative_Review: Nothing major just the Gin Palace room could have been warmer
Positive_Review: Location perfect as not very far to walk to anywhere i e Theatreland Covent Garden London Eye and great for shopping We were given an upgrade from standard room to king size room Perfect for our weekend celebration We had a room over looking the Strand no issue with noise just normal level to us Entrance reception signage all easy to follow Gin Palace was very nice although a little cool in this room Restaurant for breakfast was excellent as was the choice of breakfast Staff extremely friendly and helpful Loved every minute of being in this hotel and would recommend it to friends and family

Negative_Review: The picture on the booking site is quite deceiving The pictures potray it as very eclectic young colourful and morden but that is far from the truth The decor is quite old and smells musty almost like a nursing home
Positive_Review: It very close to main atractions of london very com

Negative_Review: We had a standard room The bed was small We were upgraded to an executive room on our last visit and the bed was larger Also our room 291 appeared to be located next to a plant room which had a water tank which was constantly filling up The noise was significant
Positive_Review: My wife was taken ill during the night and subsequently had to be taken to hospital The night staff were excellent Two staff attended the room very quickly and one checked my wife phoned for the ambulance and stayed until they arrived He also checked her regularly until the ambulance arrived Unfortunately I did not get his name but he certainly did all the right things on behalf of the hotel We thank him for his attention

Negative_Review: Room was extremely small windows were very dirty Over priced for the facilities not a 4 star hotel more like a 3 star
Positive_Review: The location of the hotel was perfect Not far from the main attractions

Negative_Review: For the price I have had better breakfasts not that it was bad but I have had better and for the price I feel it should have been really The coffee was hot black but completely tasteless The window of the room was boarded with shutters at the sides and only the centre section would open which was a bit prison like The bathroom extractor did not work and the quilt was a bit on the small side only just fitting the bed Overall it was all ok as a 3 star hotel not a 4 as advertised and for the price it was not really up to it
Positive_Review: The location is what you pay for with all that was required within easy walk of the hotel this being the main point of this hotel overall The WiFi worked as advertised which is rare in hotels these days and there were tea coffee facilities in the room

Negative_Review: The only two negatives I have for the hotel is that there was a lack of storage space for clothing and this was for a 5 day trip It s definitely not suitable for a long stay as there is nowhere to put more than a few days worth of clothes Secondly this gripe wasn t with the hotel but the room service We ordered two desserts and a cheese board on our last night usual rooms service prices overpriced The ice cream while not made in the hotel was fine The cheesecake was acceptable but not the quality you d expect and also came with strawberries not the stated raspberries small thing but we re allergic to strawberries but the issue really was with the cheeseboard It came with none of the accompaniments It was supposed to come with chutney quince jelly and cracker It was only the cheese that was delivered We called twice and asked for the missing items but they were never delivered to our room
Positive_Review: Very cute cosy room if a little warm but the radiators were adjustable Good shower and extremely quiet I d requested a quiet room on a higher floor we got number 899 The location was fantastic right in between Covent Garden and the Thames and the hotel manager was kind enough to welcome us with a bottle of Prosecco and a hand written card for my partner s birthday We got a good rate and pre paid through this site We were ultimately pretty happy with the experience

Negative_Review: Breakfast Pork excludes Jews and Muslims among others from eating suasages etc Maybe alernate with beef turkey for example Coffee was very good though
Positive_Review: Your location is unbeatable The rooms and staff are of a high standard and your Indian restaurant is excellent

Negative_Review: Staff weren t too friendly when we checked in Inconsistent customer service The breakfast was disappointing
Positive_Review: Location was great The Hotel was lovely and the bed was comfortable Very hygienic and cosy

Negative_Review: It s right on the main street and very loud late into the morning hours which kept me up Traffic is terrible so don t plan on taking transportation Everything should be done by foot or walk to the nearest subway If your luggage isn t heavy that shouldn t be a problem The rooms are outdated and quite small Bed isn t very comfortable and the shower is a step up which I imagine would be too short for a taller person I m not sure how this is a four star hotel It seemed like almost a college dorm room I was renting
Positive_Review: It s ideal if you re going to do touristy things such as site seeing and head out in London for the first time Walking distance to great restaurants and night life Price was lowest for the location

Negative_Review: The cozy room was a single room you needed to climb over each other to get in or out of the bed as it was against the wall Did get a better room for an extra 30 per night
Positive_Review: The location of the hotel makes it easy to see the sights and close to many theatres Good value meals in the restaurant Great coffee shop

Negative_Review: As above good wrvliked everthing else
Positive_Review: Bed very comfortable only one problem we had no heating in room for our stay reported it but no one came That was the only problem we use hotel every year

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: A very comfortable hotel with very helpful staff We will be using you again The position is very good as well A couple of satisfied customers

Negative_Review: The double bed was narrow The breakfasts were very standard with few fresh vegetables and limited selection of cheeses
Positive_Review: The location is excellent and the room was spacious

Negative_Review: The wardrobe was far too small our clothes barley fitted in It took 1 5 hours to have an iron and ironing board delivered Breakfast is overpriced
Positive_Review: The location is excellent for us the room although very small was adequate but a bit over priced

Negative_Review: Very Expensive drinks large ish glass of wine 9 very nice G T 13 Breakfast was too expensive so we went elsewhere
Positive_Review: Location Friendly Staff

Negative_Review: Headroom in shower a bit tight but not a real problem paid about 60 more than I did earlier in the year for the same room short stay
Positive_Review: Ideal location very central room was quiet and dark bed was comfortable and a proper shower cubicle

Negative_Review: Bedroom layout double bed against the wall access in and out of bed at night was impossible without disturbing your sleeping partner no bed side tables for reading matter or glasses cups etc not acceptable in this day and age at the price charged
Positive_Review: The location close to Covent Garden and theatre world

Negative_Review: On Monday we did not have to leave the room until 12 midday but the builders started drilling at 9am it was so loud we had to leave such a shame
Positive_Review: Absolutely great location and the check in lady was so helpful

Negative_Review: Nothing but price
Positive_Review: The location is definitely the reason of the choice 5 minutes to the river and 20minutes to most of the sightseeing sport Restaurants shopping and theaters around in minutes as well The room is small but very clean and well facilitated The staff here is helpful and nice The hotel provides speedy checkout

Negative_Review: The only light that worked in my room 528 was the bathroom light I had to leave the door open or sit on the toilet seat to read my book I came back around 12 30 pm and it seems nothing had been done with the light after I rported it
Positive_Review: Breakfast great Location great

Negative_Review: the walls between the rooms are very thin be ready to wake up when there is a wake up call in the room next door
Positive_Review: Friendly and helpful staff Excellent bed and good wifi The location is very central and works for both pleasure and business

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Superb location for seeing the shows and sightseeing in London Cozy rooms are small but not tiny and the bed was comfortable Everything was as it should be

Negative_Review: Shower made a weird noise and a It too powerful and don t cater well for certain dietary requirements so we are elsewhere
Positive_Review: Bed was very comfy and sheets very soft Room warm and perfect temperature Wow factor when walking into reception

Negative_Review: Had a double executive room but seemed very small
Positive_Review: Excellent location Good to have the espresso machine in the room Express emailed check out easy to use and avoids the madness on reception All the staff were very helpful and pleasant

Negative_Review: nothing significant to report
Positive_Review: strategic location very professional personnel at all levels the management of the hotel is very much involved in observing the quality of the services provided to the clients congratulations

Negative_Review: Because the hotel was busy breakfast was a bit of a scrum but it was perfectly fine
Positive_Review: Good location Cosy quiet and comfortable room Friendly helpful staff Lovely sausages with breakfast

Negative_Review: Everything was great A small fridge in the room might have been nice but wasn t really missed as the hotel is so close to a Tesco quick shop and the Marks and Spencer food shop in Covent Garden so that just feels a bit picky
Positive_Review: I was delighted with my stay at Strand Palace and hope to return As a solo female traveller I was concerned with safety I found the location of the hotel to be very conducive to popping out and about both in daytime and night I was able to go to theaters at night stroll back The room had been described as cosy when I booked so I was expecting very small but it was a perfect size really quite spacious for 1 The bathroom was a pleasant surprise too The staff were very helpful I also liked the fact that I was in a room on the first floor I felt that was sensitive to my single female traveller status and helped to make me feel safe This was an important trip to me my first alone in an hotel in a major city I hope to come back

Negative_Review: There were a few guests who arrived back to our floor very late They were very noisy too
Positive_Review: Everyone was very welcoming Our room was very clean and comfortable

Negative_Review: Room was a bit musty I reckon because the heat wasn t on I reported this on leaving
Positive_Review: Central location Theatre land vey accessible Shopping too accessible

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The cosy double was perfectly adequate in size for my requirements I had a lovely view of The Strand a comfortable bed and beautifully clean bathroom The staff were friendly and helpful I will certainly come to The Strand Palace again and not only because of its excellent location so near to theatres and so many of the main tourist attractions

Negative_Review: My room very tiny was in the first floor and I could hear the noise of an engine constantly much more intense during the night a nightmare
Positive_Review: location is the best feature of the hotel Clean and well organized rooms with good use of small spaces Big hotel where one can come in or go out freely

Negative_Review: The location staff and hotel were very good However the room I booked I was upgraded but when going into the bathroom from the bedroom you could not fully open the door because the sink unit stopped it opening If I were a larger person you would not get past
Positive_Review: The location staff and hotel were very good However the room I booked I was upgraded but when going into the bathroom from the bedroom you could not fully open the door because the sink unit stopped it opening If I were a larger person you would not get past

Negative_Review: Twin room is dull single beds not queen on wheels so moves no aircon but they supply an old fan The duvet has holes in it Absolutely shocking for over 200 as you have to pay a 20 supplement upon check in So 214 for one night was shocking The Hilton twin room at gatwick airport is stunning compare to this
Positive_Review: The location is good for Covent Garden and theatre in strand

Negative_Review: Noise from neighbouring bedrooms and corridors was somewhat excessive early and late
Positive_Review: Particularly liked the location and the general atmosphere and decor was clean and spacious

Negative_Review: Breakfast let it down spent too long under the lamps to keep it warm made some items overcooked eggs could have done with being cooked slightly more little runny on the top
Positive_Review: Well located for all amenities

Negative_Review: The way the price fluctuates on website bookings I paid 140 without breakfast it later went to just under a 100 with breakfast I know it s the website s fault but it makes it difficult to know when to book
Positive_Review: The staff are always very friendly and helpful I really like this hotel when I travel alone I feel very comfortable and safe and the location is brilliant

Negative_Review: Stayed here a number of times over the years This was without a doubt the worst stay Booked a cosy double which turned out to be a Single room converted into a double by the addition of a double bed against the wall Breakfast was poor and I don t think a member of staff smiled at me across the 3 days
Positive_Review: Perfect location for our trip

Negative_Review: Very small rooms restaurants and lobby not very well maintained and not clean Check in painfully slow
Positive_Review: The hotel has a great location All major site seeing spots and theaters are on walking distance

Negative_Review: Room was poor 409 I asked to move and was told they were full Noisy I could hear the conversation going on in the next room when the tv was turned down I had previously asked reception to request they turn their tv down but soon realised it was not because it was loud it was because the wall was paper thin Room was very basic and of a lesser quality than a Premier Inn totally overpriced
Positive_Review: Staff were very helpful

Negative_Review: We requested an executive quiet room but were allocated a room next door to the elevator shaft This meant we were kept awake from 4 30am Shattered when we arrived back home
Positive_Review: The location was excellent for us and for where we wanted to visit

Negative_Review: Check in is sometimes busy at peak times but efficient Single rooms are small but tidy clean and adequate
Positive_Review: Breakfasts are always very good but sometimes a bit busy Free newspapers I have stayed at the hotel many times and have not had any problems Always popular with tourists

Negative_Review: In fairness the amount paid for the room type was no better than a travel lodge or premier inn in fact I would go as far to say the 2 mentioned have better bathroom facilities and sized bedroom
Positive_Review: The staff were ok

Negative_Review: This hotel has seen better days It is worn down and the rooms and hallways need renovation The whole hotel smells of a weird soap smell which usually means that they are hiding some other smell
Positive_Review: The building is beautiful and the location is great with lot s of things to see and do all around you Breakfast was good Room was clean They price was ok and I would stay again but not for a higher price

Negative_Review: Long wait for tables for breakfast perhaps sharing a list of peak hours would help
Positive_Review: Friendly staff in reception room a bit small but comfy bed and good wifi connection

Negative_Review: Overpriced for a hotel that needs updating Our room was tiny and had no air con Won t be back You pay for the location of the hotel and not the rooms
Positive_Review: Breakfast was nice Staff were friendly Entrance impressive Location was amazing

Negative_Review: The room was tiny The breakfast was poor Tasteless bacon and black pudding that would have required a chainsaw to cut No value for money
Positive_Review: Well located within easy reach of Covent garden

Negative_Review: Cosy double rammed up against a wall couldn t swing a cat Had to request another set of towels only to be told they were in the wardrobe Walls paper thin
Positive_Review: Reception staff concierge staff in the snack coffee bar friendly and efficient

Negative_Review: The arrangement of executive breakfast for some guests was divisive The staff could have listened more to our requests and taken on board our concerns The lady on check out had a very bad attitude
Positive_Review: The Indian restaurant was lovely

Negative_Review: The luxury afternoon tea was overpriced the food was mediocre and the service was not good
Positive_Review: The room was lovely The location was amazing I got a pretty good deal online The front desk staff and concierge were helpful and friendly

Negative_Review: Only one minor issues Our room had an old internal connecting door that had been painted shut could do with removing this as could hear every word next door said as if in the same room
Positive_Review: Breakfast was great room was lovely and warm and heating was instant excellent fast shower although ends up being a bath because of this Fabulous check in with nice friendly reception teams

Negative_Review: Very old hotel and small rooms although I stayed in an executive room No mini fridge and no air conditioning but a small converter for heating Keeping in mind that I am a world traveler due to the nature of my job this hotel was by far the worst hotel I have stayed
Positive_Review: The location is close to Covent Garden

Negative_Review: No wash clothes and no sheets or blankets to cover up in bed as we Americans know them Double charged for breakfast each and every day once for downstairs restaurant where I never went and once in my room where I ate all my meals construction outside 24 hours a day made sleep all but impossible
Positive_Review: Loved the room service and housekeepers They deserve a big raise

Negative_Review: Thought the bedrooms were quite poor considering we paid quite a lot of money for 1 night and were told we had an upgrade can t imagine what the original would have been like
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Signage for the rooms could be clearer So many rooms a bit of a rabbit warren
Positive_Review: All staff excellent Great restaurants and facilities and lovely Gin Bar worth a visit

Negative_Review: Dirty there where hairs and trash on the floor The heater didn t work The room was next to a shared bathroom and you could hear literally everything The bathroom was worse than a public bathroom The hole hostel had bad smell We had to live right away because it was horrible and they charged us the two night anyway The photos are a lie
Positive_Review: Nothing

Negative_Review: The reception staff were very cool and to start with not friendly at all a staff member had to come out from the back to book us in even though 3 people were standing behind the counter discussing what seemed to be their social life The hotel was I m sure lovely in its day nut now seems very tired and not worth the 300 a night that we paid gor our room
Positive_Review: Location is great and the bar staff were lovely Unfortunately that was all I liked about the hotel but that s just our opinion

Negative_Review: Carpet all over the place Computers under maintenance for the majority of the stay
Positive_Review: Breakfast Location Free and good WiFi Free water and snacks added daily in the room

Negative_Review: the only thing that was missing was a towel rack in the bathroom and i had trouble with the light in the bathroom the closer i got to the mirror the darker it got
Positive_Review: cozy but very nice room the staff was very friendly cozy bed and nice bathroom the breakfast was ok but it was not the best i ever had

Negative_Review: When I was checking out the reception lady was a bit grumpy Very different from the helpful and pleasant reception staff who helped me when I was checking in
Positive_Review: Location Very central near to all the musical theatres which I am really after Concierge staff was very helpful in helping me get discounted tickets for the musicals Had a lovely stay there

Negative_Review: The room was very cramped and overheated The staff rushed off their feet as the hotel was incredibly busy The concierge was particularly uncooperative
Positive_Review: It was close to Waterloo Station

Negative_Review: My mattress was not very comfortable not terrible but could have been better
Positive_Review: The staff where very friendly and professionally helpful They had local knowledge which helped me to make the most of my stay Even when I signed out the lady offered to get me a taxi and helped with directions to the nearest station when I said that I planned to walk I was very pleased with my complimentary upgrade I specifically stayed near an event on Aldwich so the hotel position is superb

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: Check in and check out very good quick and easy Room was ready when we got there at 12 40 very clean bathroom could probably do with updating but shower was lovely and powerful Bed wasn t that comfortable as I prefer a softer mattress Having said that I slept very well Saw better looking hotels for the money I paid but the location cannot be beaten especially if you are going to the theatre Worth every penny just for that

Negative_Review: Small room No A C this is usually not an issue in London but I was there during warm weather The room had a small fan which was fine but for a much warmer day it wouldn t have been enough Does London ever have much warmer days I don t know
Positive_Review: Low price by London standards Good location near all of the main sights and only one block from my meeting location

Negative_Review: Nothing to do with the hotel but in future I ll book direct through the hotel as it s no cheaper using one of the comparison sites and the hotel give you a free bottle of prosecco plus a money off voucher for the restaurant by booking direct
Positive_Review: The facilities were fine bed was large comfy and clean Staff polite and location brilliant

Negative_Review: Had trouble booking in as 2 rooms on different floors despite requesting being close together and telephoning the day before Wasted 1 2 hour to get sorted Staff really need to try harder not rude but just not helpful Disjointed policies Letter for Exec Room given at check in said waiter at bfast would help with Express Check out but they knew nothing Concierge said drop ur keys in box at Reception but there was no box I asked Reception n they just took room keys off me no How was you stay or Is there anything else I can help with Hotel VERY VERY noisy hardly got any sleep Won t be coming back
Positive_Review: Location is great

Negative_Review: Not a friendly welcoming at check in Got a room with very thin walls and a drunk arguing and partying couple next door that was very noisy between midnight and 7 o clock in the morning This ruined my sleep completely Breakfasts the next morning was also a disappointment when it comes to the quality of what was served Overall one of the worst hotel experiences I ve ever had
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: Waiting for lifts but it s a big hotel with lots of guests so that s to be expected
Positive_Review: Compact single room with bath very clean and quiet as requested Liked the wooden blinds rather than curtains much cleaner and neater Good breakfast choice

Negative_Review: the room given was classed as a Executive king the room was awful 101 then put in 802 if I remember awful view light none existent eventually given room 204 a king room much better but told we would not get a refund
Positive_Review: The location is fantastic the staff very helpful very nice place

Negative_Review: Noisy room other guests note people who stay are a bit chavvy made worse by noise on the street that woke us up and staff who really could not care and were utterly hopeless It s not cheap
Positive_Review: Clean spacious rooms and a sensible gym Great location

Negative_Review: Greasy breakfast choices and a minimal selection of options for those of us who start the day vegetarian
Positive_Review: I LOVED Francesca at the desk who let us check in early and suggested we get a larger room than I booked she offered a 30 pound per night upgrade for 20 I appreciated the cleaning staff While I don t normaly tip housekeeping this time I did The concierge service was helpful And I loved the location And I loved the fact that the coffee was brewed and delicious Magda was another stand out employee

Negative_Review: Decor a little dated No view from window
Positive_Review: Excellent location to Covent Garden shows Centre of London good access to tube stations Embankment and Covent Garden Room clean and good size Great Breakfast Friendly staff

Negative_Review: Mixup on checking out with Reception asking me for payment for breakfast added on to my bill when computer showed I had already paid for an added in breakfast This meant that someone had given my room number at breakfast when I was staying alone
Positive_Review: Loved the treatment from the friendly young man who helped me in reception on arrival After hearing I was a returning guest he gave me an upgrade without me having to ask

Negative_Review: Rooms are small There was only 1 plus for watercooker shade phonecharger Not really handy Could do with some freshing up
Positive_Review: Location is defenitely a great plus Staff is very friendly and helpful

Negative_Review: BATHROOM IN MY ROOM WAS MADE FOR A TINY CIRCUS CLOWN WITH NO ARMS IT IS TOTALLY RIDICULOUS FUNCTIONALLY IT WOULD HAVE BEEN BETTER TO HAVE IT SITED OUT IN THE HALLWAY OR THE SHOWER
Positive_Review: breakfast is pretty good but essential for early morning start on the day location is amazingly useful rooms are clean but one can be given a bizarrely small room that barely has room to walk in others are ok staff is friendly one can send items to print to hotel printer

Negative_Review: I guess thin walls between the rooms I heard everything happening at neighbors room o
Positive_Review: Great location Close to major sights you want to see in London Pretty clean

Negative_Review: Every time the toilet flushed there was a very loud noise that lasted for 5 mins and was very disturbing especially in the middle of the night When I told reception in the morning there was no interest and not even an apology Very unhelpful
Positive_Review: The bed was comfy Nice breakfast

Negative_Review: The bed was hard the pillows tired the walls paper thin and the room stuffy and poorly ventilated The duvet cover had a hole in it and needed to be retired The checkout receptionist was also quite abrupt which was a change from the check in staff unfortunately A grumpy lady at the breakfast sitting made us feel unwelcome but luckily was made up for by cheerful staff internally
Positive_Review: The location was great for the theatres

Negative_Review: Poor hotel for the price Rooms very basic Uncomfortable beds Queuing for breakfast Sticky tables Cold buffet breakfast

Negative_Review: It would be good to have aircon rather than just a fan The beds could be a bit larger too

Positive_Review: Bathroom very clean beds comfortables staff friendly and well educated Hotel well located near 3 underground stations and near boats on the Thames

Negative_Review: too long wait at the lifts

Negative_Review: Only one small issue pillows were vey hard and uncomfortable

Positive_Review: The location is excellent You can walk to Trafalgar Square Covent Garden Liecester Square etc

Negative_Review: No Negative

Positive_Review: Location was great Very nice and professional staff who dealt with my room which smelt bad and gave me a better room thank you The room had a kettle which was great

Negative_Review: No Negative

Positive_Review: Comfy bed Good location

Negative_Review: As in many hotels breakfasting alone was a gamble go to get toast and your table s been reallocated before you return

Negative_Review: The fact that there was no air con in the room thankfully the weather was very hot for our stay but we enjoyed

Negative_Review: Breakfast was fine but some foods were a wee bit tough i e Bacon black pudding

Positive_Review: Staff very friendly and helpful in all areas particularly breakfast service where nothing was too much trouble Room very bright clean had both bath and shower and was of a reasonable size for London Location excellent for a range of theatres restaurants and the markets of Covent Garden It is a very short walk to the Embankment use the steps down from Waterloo Bridge alongside Somerset House for access for a stroll by the River Thames The walk to BIg Ben takes approximately 10 15 minutes but as we passed and stopped to examine Clepatra s Needle the Sphynx and the Battle of Britain memorials on the way it did take us a little longer Lovely way to get to Westminster with much to see both on and off the water whilst walking and a good number of ornate benches on the way just to sit and watch the world go by

Negative_Review: No Negative

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Hotels location is fantastic We really enjoyed our stay the staff were always very pleasant and helpful We would definitely stay there again and recommend to other s

Negative_Review: Nothing
