Positive_Review: I liked the bath robes and slippers the little extras and the excellent level of cleanliness

Negative_Review: Nothing Our most recent stay was excellent
Positive_Review: This hotel is conveniently located in central London It is easy to walk to all the major central London tourist hot spots Underground stations are within a short walk and bus stops are adjacent to the hotel Staff are friendly polite and helpful The hotel is always spotlessly clean Rooms are well appointed and have everything you need for a stay in London

Negative_Review: Single rooms tend to be small and with no view I understand the reason for this lack of space in central London Very high price

Positive_Review: Great location handy for theatres Covent Garden restaurants easy to get to the South Bank Tate Modern and Shakespeare s Globe good breakfast staff generally friendly and helpful Nice new bathroom

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Staff are extremely welcoming and professional Really made you think you d want to return in the future Fantastic location Covent Garden theatreland and Soho on the doorstep Excellent public transport links buses outside the dor tube five minutes walk

Negative_Review: Queueing for breakfast Staff in breakfast room a little lacking manners when you are carrying your food to table Although food good bacon very overcooked
Positive_Review: Convenient location helpful and attentive staff and suitable overnight hotel for central London visit Lovely hotel

Negative_Review: The hotel has been refurbished and I feel a bit sorry that no air conditioning has been installed in the rooms especially because the windows can only be opened a little
Positive_Review: I liked everything and breakfast is simply super As I am a theaterbuff the location of the hotel is super Buses and tube are within easy reach and many City highlights are within walking distance Staff are very friendly I stayed at the hotel at least 7 times and I hope to be back soon

Negative_Review: The bed was rather too firm for me
Positive_Review: The room space had been well thought out for a budget room The breakfasts were excellent Apart from an occasional plumbing noise the soundproofing was good

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: The staff were extremely polite friendly and helpful The room was spotless and the huge bed was very comfortable There was a great variety of food for breakfast and it was all well cooked and attractively presented We can also recommend The Carvery both for quality of food and value for money We particularly appreciated the way we could leave our luggage with the concierge after we had checked out so that we didn t have to lug it around London for the rest of the day

Negative_Review: I had unfortunately used Booking com and made a slight error When I called the hotel one member of staff said I would definitely need to contact Booking com again I tried but could not get a response from them so I called the hotel again and another member of staff told me she could make the amendment after all I was grateful that the second member of staff knew what she was doing Next time I shall book directly with the hotel as they give you incentives when you book through them
Positive_Review: My room was changed to a quieter part of the hotel as last time I stayed I was woken up very early by bottles being emptied also this time I did not have an adjoining room which was great as you can hear everything through the walls So I finally got the peace and quiet I deserved

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: My room was billed as cosy which meant very very small but it met my needs as a single traveler and the value was very good considering that this is a full service hotel on The Strand in walking distance to theaters museums and many shops and restaurants

Negative_Review: The parsnips on the carvery were partially burnt My room did not have air conditioning although they did give me a fan When I book through your site I usually get an ordinary room This time I got a single which was rather small although the bathroom was very nice
Positive_Review: The hotel location suited my activities I could use the bus across the road to get to most places I wanted The staff were also very pleasant Breakfast was good

Negative_Review: Rooms adequate in size but beware of lowest price level as rooms are tiny If that is what your budget allows then price is very reasonable for city centre
Positive_Review: Perfect location for all London attractions and priced fairly for such a central location

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: very happy and surprised when checking in that we had been upgraded and a request made by a family member to the hotel was met they more than fulfilled the ask A very happy newly engaged couple

Negative_Review: The place is overpriced for the type of room you get If you are single you are better off in a hostel You will get a better accommodation there The rooms have no air conditioning and are closed off from air making it very hot in the rooms and uncomfortable The beds are saggy and are worse than some hostels Not what I would expect from a so called 3 or 4 star hotel I would avoid this place
Positive_Review: Good Location

Negative_Review: Room on the Strand road side and having stayed before this was the first time we stayed on the road won t do it again at night you can really hear the traffic and did affect getting to sleep
Positive_Review: Location fantastic for getting around

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Great location for walking around the centre of London and close to Trafalgar Square Handy for museums theatres and shops I ll use it again next time I m in London

Negative_Review: Very noisy cleaners early in the morning and kept trying to get into the room Maybe update cleaners on who has and hasn t checked out
Positive_Review: clean comfortable and value for money

Negative_Review: The room was tiny no air conditioning so very warm through the night Everything was in the way of the plugs A double bed but against a wall not easy to get in and out off They call it the Cosy Double don t be fooled cosy tiny
Positive_Review: The location was good

Negative_Review: Room either too hot or too noisy It overlooked the inside area which had some very noisy fans running 24h With closed windows the room was too hot Impossible to get a good night s sleep
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: not even small refridgerator small windows not allowing the air to circulate not clear information about the services in the hotel booklet long time to wait for a lift
Positive_Review: great location

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: Great staff at breakfast and a wide selection of foods Also the hotel gave my husband and I a Happy Birthday muffin which was in the room for us

Negative_Review: Rooms a bit small for the price we paid but well appointed I guess if you had masses of luggage it could be a problem This wasn t an issue for us as we were over nighters
Positive_Review: it is a very comfortable hotel with bars and restaurants within striding distance The hotel facilities are superb if you are feeling to lazy to go out Location is great

Negative_Review: The WiFi never worked in my room
Positive_Review: The location and cleanliness I was upgraded to a double room from the single room I had booked so making it good value for the centre of London

Negative_Review: Very uncomfortable and stiflingly hot I contemplated sleeping in the lobby as it seemed to be the only place that had air conditioning Not worth a fraction of the price it commands
Positive_Review: Very close to Covent Garden

Negative_Review: Room and bathroom too small The cost didn t justify what was probably the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel Other people I spoke to in the bar said the same so it wasn t just our room
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: In order to check in two hours early to our cleaned and ready room the front desk required a 20 pound fee Perhaps worth it but we skipped the option and went to have lunch There s no fee to have them hold your luggage
Positive_Review: The breakfast buffet offered a convenient tasty option that was a really good buy The fitness room in the hotel was adequate to provide a good workout in a pleasant setting The hotel is a terrific buy in terms of its good amenities and the excellent location

Negative_Review: Ridiculously small room even for London no A C bit too expensive for what you get
Positive_Review: Location cleanliness housekeeping staff check in and check out Luggage storage after check out

Negative_Review: Asked for room to be decorated for birthday Was told it could be possible Asked what time we would be out On our return nothing had been done
Positive_Review: Had a gift of breakfast in bed but the pastries were very dry Bed not big enough for a 6 foot plus male

Negative_Review: Not being able to open windows very hot in bedroom bathroom
Positive_Review: We have stayed here before great location and staff mostly helpful Lady on check in was really helpful as we had a few rooms and she helped sort our booking out Thank you again and we look forward to returning

Negative_Review: Room not ready when arrived Second morning breakfast delayed by lack of staff We booked an executive room and felt it wasn t value for money
Positive_Review: Location is Excellent Cleanliness is excellent

Negative_Review: The room was absolutely airless to the point of stifling although I had an extre night booked I decided to leave one night early as I couldn t stand another night of roasting in hell I had a single room one night facing a wall so changed to a double not much bigger still facing a wall and like an oven Also they were very unbending about changing one night s accommodation for me to another although in money terms it wouldn t have changed anything for them and the room was available it would have made another loyal customer for them it is not great to shoot themselves in the foot by some silly rules that can be adjusted in special circumstances Every customer counts and word of mouth is still the best or worst advert The hotel is called grand but in fact it is a very tired hotel and needs an update badly I would be spending my money somewhere else in the future
Positive_Review: The staff were nice but scatty two mornings my tea and gluten free bread took over 20 minutes to get to me not great when you need to be at work

Negative_Review: small room with very noisy extractor fans from outside our room also the fans generated heat which made our room unbearable to sleep in
Positive_Review: location was excellent

Negative_Review: the size of the room and bed and that it was againt the wall there was no aircon only a fan which was too noisey
Positive_Review: the location the efficiency of the staff

Negative_Review: First room was noisy but then I was moved to another one which was perfect
Positive_Review: Nice food cosy room excelente location really close to Covent Garden and Trafalgar Square Served by Picadilly Line excelent if you re arriving from Heathrow Airport

Negative_Review: Breakfast was good but not great Like many London hotels very busy and they struggle at times to deal with the numbers at reception and in the restaurant
Positive_Review: Great location Easy walk to Trafalgar Square or Theatres Lots of restaurants around Had an executive room which was a good size quiet and comfortable This is our second stay and equally as good

Negative_Review: There was a heat wave in London and the rooms were not air conditioned It was hard to sleep and impossible to rest in the room We had to hang in the lobby to stay cool The rooms were also very small for twin rooms
Positive_Review: I liked the service and I liked the facilities the lobby the restaurant the concierge etc The location was perfect for us

Negative_Review: Everything was fine echo the view from the window but that could be changed Perhaps air conditioning could be installed but a fan was provided
Positive_Review: Room was spacious and well equipped and very quiet

Negative_Review: Rooms were far to small described as COZY small should be the word not cozy Bath rooms dated as well So for the money I won t be staying again
Positive_Review: location

Negative_Review: We went for an executive suite However this was just a normal room by all accounts Fabulously big bed but some furnishings looking a bit tired and the bathroom was tiny Also for an executive suite the room itself was actually quite small
Positive_Review: The location is fabulous very close to Covent Garden and the theatres Easy to get to and great customer service by all the staff who served us Lots of facilities available too The breakfast which came with the Executive Room was very good indeed

Negative_Review: For cost would have hoped to have air con in the room A fan was provided but not sufficient to keep the room cool without the window open which meant street noise Bed small and uncomfortable
Positive_Review: Super location close to tube and local attractions Good restaurants close by Well presented room

Negative_Review: Not a major problem but there was a bit of a wait at reception when checking in and out Another member of staff to receive guests would have been welcome
Positive_Review: Clean good facilities pleasant helpful staff good food good location

Negative_Review: Air conditioning in room We were there during a heat wave
Positive_Review: Location was perfect was right in the middle of everything Walking distance to all places of interest

Negative_Review: Queuing up for breakfast or being guided to a makeshift breakfast space is no fun
Positive_Review: The perfect location Walkable to all the main sites shopping and right across the best musicals in town

Negative_Review: Bathroom very compact shower over bath awkward and not that easy to control water direction Toilet in bathroom needed fixing during our stay poor flush Room very hot
Positive_Review: The location near theatres Covent garden is excellent Concierge staff were especially pleasant helpful Very good breakfast Cleanliness A Would stay again if visiting London

Negative_Review: Do not rely on the pictures as a guide as the rooms are smaller than pictured Not great value for money in terms of the room but we were not in it that often so it didn t affect us too much
Positive_Review: Great central location Very clean and upmarket lobby area and bar restauraunt area

Negative_Review: This older property only has air conditioning in the lobby so in summer and warmer days of spring you ll be using the provided oscillating fan and an open window to cool off There is a heating radiator for winter I think my son was a little disappointed that the rooms were rather Spartan compared to the sparkling lobby but a hotel should never be the reason for your travel
Positive_Review: Hotel location is terrific and central Covent Garden for seeing London near bridges museums The Eye theatre so much within walking distance and the rest a short cab ride or tube ride away The rooms are clean and well taken care of for an older property Beds are okay

Negative_Review: Old fashioned rooms and no air conditioning
Positive_Review: Great facilities and breakfast was excellent Female staff member in gin palace was great and dealt with some difficult customers very well

Negative_Review: Lower price of the breakfast would have made this perfect or possibly some discount to breakfast places nearby
Positive_Review: The gentlemen at the front doors I just love them created a real British feeling and made us so happy and appreciated quests Also the lobby is nice and peaceful a real contrast to one who steps in from the Strand

Negative_Review: Room wasn t ready when we turned up to check in and they didn t seem to have a clue why and we waited for an hour to get the room key
Positive_Review: Location spot on

Negative_Review: It was much too hot in the room which was on the second floor With the window open there was something industrial pumping out noise and heat all night just under the window so sleep was impossible There was no air conditioning and when I inquired having booked a single room I was told that there was only air conditioning in double rooms and I should have booked that This was not made apparent when I booked online and also would have meant a significant cost increase in an already expensive hotel Also they charged for ice the ice machine on the 1st floor cost 1 for a small tub of ice I have never stayed in a hotel which charged for ice from the ice machine
Positive_Review: The mattress felt good very firm And the towels were large

Negative_Review: With being only overnight we did not have any qualms
Positive_Review: Stayed in a variety of hotels in past and had the most uncomfortable of sleep the Strand offered quietness and a very comfortable night s rest

Negative_Review: 1 rooms were smaller then a prison cell 2 invest in some air conditioning boiling hot 3 had to have a very warm shower as the showers were broken 4 receptionist wouldn t let us check into our rooms unless all our guests we re present we booked 2 rooms as one was a surprise for the birthday boy she was rude until we explained the situation 5 rooms were not ready by the time we got there and this was at 6 pm 6 bed was very small and uncomfortable 7 definitely a waste of 380 00 for 2 rooms wouldn t even pay 50 00 for both the rooms
Positive_Review: Lobby was presentable everything else was awful

Negative_Review: It s a huge hotel with many rooms on inner courts Because of a late booking we had a room on the first floor with barely any view on the court wall and sunlight next to the maids room quite noisy unless you plan to study Polish 4 star price for a one star situation Check the room floor and situation if you can
Positive_Review: Although the chief receptionist was a cold poker face employees were very nice and helpful The gym is a real plus The hotel is well located to visit most of London although you will have to walk a bit for the nearest tube stations Temple and Embankment The building itself is not astonishing and brand new but the room are very well cleaned and bathrooms are convenient and neat It s close to many theaters if you plan to attend shows Covent Garden is a 5 minutes walk from the hotel

Negative_Review: A bit noisy with window open but fine with earplugs
Positive_Review: Clean and modern Unbeatable location Room was small but perfectly adequate if you re out and about most of the time Good breakfast and pleasant and efficient staff

Negative_Review: room was expensive but as we paid for location it was to be expected I suppose
Positive_Review: location to convent garden which we love was excellent lots shops pubs and restaurants

Negative_Review: Restaurant for breakfast was quite small given the size of the hotel however food was good
Positive_Review: Staff were exceptionally friendly we didn t eat in the hotel for dinner but can strongly recommend the gin palace for a nightcap yumi

Negative_Review: Found the breakfast area rather crowded and cramped Food just average Charging 5 pounds per night to leave luggage is a joke also having to pay for a map the first hotel ever to do this
Positive_Review: Excellent location comfortable beds and clean Friendly and helpful staff

Negative_Review: Nothing all good
Positive_Review: There was so much to like about this hotel Traditional feel in a modern setting location close to Covent Garden theatres and the Thames Staff were very professional but also very friendly and genuinely polite Very good value for money including drinks a food that was not part of the booking an absolute gem of a hotel

Negative_Review: Breakfast was horrible could of done with more healthy options ie Museli don t waste your money Room was too dark and gloomy
Positive_Review: Great bathroom and bath Staff were friendly and helpful

Negative_Review: The room was too hot couldn t open the windows wide enough to get some fresh air in so neither of us got much sleep The view was bad into some scruffy courtyard with other windows but that didn t bother us that much I guess we got what we paid for
Positive_Review: Loved the location the breakfast and the decor of the hotel The staff were very friendly and polite

Negative_Review: Second time to stay here 4th floor is far more dated than the 2nd Smaller old fashioned room Could hear the people next door
Positive_Review: The receptionist was very welcoming and friendly The location is great

Negative_Review: This Hotel is advertised as 4 star The room we booked was a standard room It was small the bed was small pillows uncomfortable no air con and the room was hot if the window was open the noise from the street was very loud problems with the plumbing very noisy
Positive_Review: No Positive

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: It was amazing the staff were great the facilities were very good it was quiet Not to hot and not to cold very good shower Will definitely go back there on our next visit to London everything was within walking distance and if you didn t want to walk buses and trains were very easy to get to I haven t got any bad comments or regrets the whole visit was brilliant

Negative_Review: Small expensive rooms 3 toilet repairs in 6 days Maintenance twice tried and failed to solve TV tuning problems friends had similar TV problem Hotel lounge refused to show Euro 2016 on their TV 1 of 2 treadmills and 1 of 2 bikes were down for maintenance
Positive_Review: Beautiful hotel with nice staff in terrific location Small but OK fitness center Manager gave us 15 GBP voucher and bottle of sparkling wine to partly make up for maintenance problems but would not adjust room rate

Negative_Review: I asked for a quiet room Away from lifts It was away from lifts but it wasn t quiet There was noise from either air conditioning units or electrical unit It woke me up a couple of times I cant put my finger on what the noise was but it did disturb my sleep Left luggage not very well run bit chaotic Little bit dismissive surly
Positive_Review: Location and check in lady great Clean room and bed very comfortable

Negative_Review: Some of the items from the breakfast where cold
Positive_Review: The location the availability of the staff Some of the staff on the day of my departure from the hotel went beyond the limit and showed excellent customer service

Negative_Review: Lighting in bathroom could be better
Positive_Review: Warm and friendly greeting speedy check in Room comfortable and spotless dressing gowns and slippers what a treat Super breakfast lots of lovely fresh fruit

Negative_Review: the breakfast was okay the vegetables didn t look edible the tomatoes weren t cooked the room was way to hot and noisy
Positive_Review: The staff were friendly

Negative_Review: No air con meant the room would most likely be hot during high Summer
Positive_Review: The room was very clean the location fantastic the bath tub was perfect for soothing tired limbs All in all a very enjoyable experience of London

Negative_Review: Noisy pipes in the bathroom But they got a plumber Housekeeping knocked really early on the day I was checking out
Positive_Review: The bar staff and carvery staff were lovely The blackout shutters on the window made it easier to sleep and the room was quiet

Negative_Review: lunch could have been complementary similar to other hotels
Positive_Review: the best thing about the place is its location the facility is ok although my room was a bit small but overall i had a pleasant stay and a good experience

Negative_Review: Room was very hot and only a quilt on the bed Would have been nice to have the option of a sheet instead Other than that the hotel was perfect for what we wanted and was great value for money
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: Older staff disjointed Night staff some trouble with English and basic service Small rooms No AC
Positive_Review: Great location close to palace Thames attractions and great pubs

Negative_Review: Nothing
Positive_Review: Breakfast is excellent plus bar food although bit pricy but it is London and no dearer than anywhere else Cant fault the hotel and cleanliness of rooms best i know

Negative_Review: Evening dinner could have been better Told I was upgraded but in reality it was a disability room on the first floor Traffic noise a minor irritation
Positive_Review: Breakfast was good Location good for my business purpose

Negative_Review: There was no toilet brush in the toilet and only cleaned on 2nd day and bedsheets were not changed for the whole 3 days
Positive_Review: Concierge porter service great location

Negative_Review: More choice of non cooked food Fresh fruit Healthier options
Positive_Review: Room very small for two people not value for money Very poor breakfast not worth the money so glad we only paid 10

Negative_Review: We did ask for early check in due to having tickets to a matinee at the theatre so we could get ready and this was agreed in advance and a payment of 20 was agreed for this but on arrival they had no rooms available for early check so this was cancelled
Positive_Review: The location was brilliant walking distance to everywhere and plenty to do and see Hotel was lovely and staff were very helpful

Negative_Review: Room was quite basic and small even though we was given an upgrade for the price we paid was hoping for something a bit more spacious
Positive_Review: Location excellent

Negative_Review: The bed was not comfy the room cleaners woke me up The bar does not sell good old British pints of beer Only expensive bottle beer at this hotel How can you have a London Hotel not selling British pints of beer
Positive_Review: The location and price

Negative_Review: Cleanness of rooms could ve been better Room was tidy but could use some refresh Facilities like the gym was a misunderstanding with not all functional gear and ppl queue to use it
Positive_Review: Location the main option I ve chosen this hotel wasn t disappointed Staff was helpful and understanding

Negative_Review: The single room had no a c No access to open the minute window The bathroom was so small it was difficult to move around Bed was hard Room was tired could do with updating
Positive_Review: Good size TV in the room It was very quiet considering location Friendly staff

Negative_Review: The sound insulation was very poor I could hear exactly what was going on in the next bathroom and felt like I was sleeping in the corridor with the noise from passing people Also the solid wooden shutters at the window made the room really dark
Positive_Review: The room was very clean and tastefully decorated and the bed was really comfy All staff I came across were polite friendly and helpful

Negative_Review: Front desk said local calls were free but then got charged 20p for two calls No big deal but misleading
Positive_Review: Very friendly staff Polite Helpful Location really perfect for tourists

Negative_Review: The room was a little dated for the price you pay The restaurant manager was a little pushy trying to turn tables when it was not that busy for breakfast I noticed some guests were not to happy with him
Positive_Review: The location was perfect for walking and getting around London And the staff at the front desk and concierge were professional and quite personable

Negative_Review: Telephone was dead toilet flush is not that good We paid about 300USD night feel little bit overpriced
Positive_Review: The location can not be better we could walk many iconic places and access to several lines in 5min walk I am really glad we stayed at this hotel Concierge was excellent

Negative_Review: Our room was called a cosy room which was basically small which we didn t mind However Unfortunatley the walls a paper thin we had very noisy people next door we had to complain the last night ask the staff to sort it out which they did But they continued been loud then decided to have the tv on It was after 4 when all went quite we could then get some sleep
Positive_Review: The hotel was pretty central to where we wanted to be easy to get to the tube or buses

Negative_Review: Mirrors are too far away to put makeup on properly Tv fixed to wall in wrong position Not really that much of a pribl though as we didnt watch it much
Positive_Review: Liked location and helpful staff

Negative_Review: Hard bed and this has been our 3rd time to have a cosy room The rooms are getting smaller each time and the bed against the wall is NOT cosy for two people Will not be staying again
Positive_Review: good breakfast choices

Negative_Review: Room overlooking the Strand was quite noisy when the windows were open
Positive_Review: Was upgraded which is always nice Doorman was very helpful getting me a taxi in torrential rain

Negative_Review: Bit on the expensive side for just one but I m worth it
Positive_Review: Totally convenient for my trip to Art Galleries and meeting friends Fresh juicey apple available on desk at reception which was a nice touch after walking down to the Strand from Euston Plus I was given fresh water to drink while I checked in

Negative_Review: Not value for money Room like a cell No air conditioning If there hadn t been a fan to use I would have left as humidity affects my health
Positive_Review: Staff friendly

Negative_Review: Everything was great
Positive_Review: We have used this hotel several times the staff are very polite and helpful last time we stayed they upgraded us to executive room which was great food is also very good

Negative_Review: Could have done with a fridge in the room but wasn t a major problem
Positive_Review: Super location excellent for theatre area Very helpful staff Well worth a stay

Negative_Review: Hotel rooms need a make over e g some bathroom fittings were missing and must be at least 20 years old Room was also small
Positive_Review: Great location especially for theatres galleries and London sites generally

Negative_Review: Rooms are very small but they are ok for London standards Lobby decor is very old fashioned with fish tanks
Positive_Review: Best location ever near metro station Covent Garden many many many good restaurants expensive and cheap good service for what the hotel is its location etc it offers a GREAT cost benefit relation I would stay in Strand Palace again and will recommend it to everybody

Negative_Review: The breakfast Being woken up at 1 00 and then 2 00 in the morning Had to have the window open no air con being on the second floor hear all the noises of the centre courtyard
Positive_Review: Pleasant staff

Negative_Review: The breakfasts needs a shake up Fruit not always fresh breakfast too sameish Especially for people who stay more than three nights I know it was part of our package and we chose that I suggest an opt out option should be allowed
Positive_Review: HELPFUL STAFF CLEAN HOTEL

Negative_Review: The cooked breakfast had been sitting under the heat lamps for too long so had dried out but the rest was great croissants and fruit cheese and ham etc
Positive_Review: Comfortable bed cosy rooms are small but not an issue as a base when you re staying in London The 8th floor had a great view of the storms across London too

Negative_Review: Choice of room far too small We did not understand how small a cosy room would be Next time we will be more careful Noisy fan somewhere near our room
Positive_Review: Breakfast was too cool the first morning I told them Next morning fine Friendly staff throughout Sheer convenience of the location Choice of tubes stations and the contactless card makes journeying on the Underground so easy for northern Scots as well as others I presume Great tailor next door G R Check them out for yourselves Walking is easy around here Covent Garden has lots going on any day and you can always stop to be entertained in the pedestrian area

Negative_Review: The queue to get into breakfast
Positive_Review: The room was a good size shower was powerful The breakfast fresh plentiful and the scrambled egg so moist and fluffy

Negative_Review: Think drinks but pricey and room a bit small toilet squashed behind the door but was ok for 1 night
Positive_Review: The hotel is lovely staff very friendly although wasn t sure to tip the porter and think annoyed him But he was helpful and pleasant It s good location for the west end if going to shows and Covent Garden is a short walk away It s quite expensive as in London and thought room was bit small for the price but clean and tidy The man who you give bags too was brilliant and very helpful Couldn t fault the place Great place to go also good was nice for breakfast

Negative_Review: Can not understand why when I booked over the internet that I was quoted 20 per head for breakfast which I was willing to pay 80 for four breakfasts on my visa card and when I got to the hotel and said I would like to pay hotel and breakfast in cash instead of my Visa card Breakfast dropped straight away to 10 per head Also I booked an early arrival booking lunch time nothing was mentioned about the extra 20 fee I had to pay until I arrived at the hotel I think you should give better details to those hotel sites internet you have your details on I will stay again at your hotel but will certainly not include breakfast until I arrive and pay cash for them at 10 per head cheaper Mx
Positive_Review: Breakfast s was good the room was very clean and nice hotel staff very helpful and pleasant We enjoyed our stay at The Strand Palace thank you Mx

Negative_Review: Lack of natural daylight No fridge in room Although bed comfortable I thought the room was overpriced
Positive_Review: Bed was extremely comfortable Breakfast was excellent

Negative_Review: No Negative
Positive_Review: I was really surprised and impressed by how quiet the room was considering how busy it was outside The food was really good and the staff were really helpful and friendly

Negative_Review: Room was really warm and if we opened the windows the noise from the traffic was rather loud
Positive_Review: Excellent location for the theatre sightseeing and restaurants Breakfast was really good liked the atmosphere of the overflow breakfast restaurant Wifi was quick and reliable

Negative_Review: 1 Room seemed soulless 2 Breakfast just OK big queue for it on 2nd morning at 9am and so didn t bother went round corner into Covent Garden for breakfast
Positive_Review: Location for Covent Garden and theatreland Much cheaper than other comparable hotels in vicinity

Negative_Review: The staff were not helpful upon arrival when my 22 year old son and I arrived to find we were sharing a small bed together after booking online I realise this might have been my fault although I thought I had booked 2 X single beds They were not helpful in resolving this smoothly and quickly instead focast on charging an extra 40 to 60 GBP We were not impressed and in my 15 years of travel have never experienced this Normally if there are issues on arrival the staff are more than happy to accomodate and move people to assist with their requests This was certainly not the case
Positive_Review: The location

Negative_Review: The rooms were far to small for the price that was paid and they were not very clean The view out of the window was poor
Positive_Review: The location was excellent

Negative_Review: My room was extremely noisy as of the evening till the morning A mad noise like a plane engine This was very bad and disappointing that such nice hotel have such noisy rooms These rooms should never be rented if they are next to super noisy engine rooms
Positive_Review: Excellent location at 2 min from Covent Garden and 5 min from Charing Cross underground station Very lively and nice area

Negative_Review: Breakfast was very overcrowded and we were at a folding table and event chairs in a hot windowless room Even though breakfast was paid for we only took it once and ate out for the other breakfasts Bed mattress was very tired Housekeeping was variable first night we had no water second night we did
Positive_Review: Location is really excellent

Negative_Review: Still a lot of money for us for one night in a hotel even allowing for the great location
Positive_Review: Great location right on the Strand and so convenient for an after theatre stay We were upgraded to a slightly larger room The breakfast was good with plenty of choice Staff very helpful

Negative_Review: I d have liked a fridge to store fresh milk in
Positive_Review: Terrific location for our needs we went to two theatres on the Strand The Dawaat restaurant was great too the food was excellent and staff lovely The food was good value for money in the West End

Negative_Review: No AC unless you are exec Beds need an upgrade for comfort Business center is severely lacking nothing more than three computers and printers that are consistently out of toner Some of the Gym equipment not working
Positive_Review: Staff excellent very accommodating with high marks for service

Negative_Review: The room I asked for in advance was not available at the time I finished up on the 6th floor and I just had a operation this was not good for me I ask for a 1st floor
Positive_Review: Everything was about average

Negative_Review: Before I booked with booking com they said that I had got the best deal so I booked with them The next day on my computer TRIVAGO where doing the same deal 100 pounds cheaper I know what I will do next time And there will be next time
Positive_Review: Location

Negative_Review: Bar closes at 11 when you have spent a lot of money on a nice meal that didn t really start until 9 it was ridiculously rushed on the end no time to repair for the evening
Positive_Review: The atmosphere location food

Negative_Review: Shower in room was bust Though reported to concierge it took nearly 2 days to repair Room was very hot Side doors with wheelchair ramp were very heavy and difficult to open from wheelchair Bedroom was a bit small
Positive_Review: Location was great Wheelchair fitted in lift and bedroom bathroom was accessible with good grab rails Evening dinner was good and breakfast was good

Negative_Review: The food too much was produced at the same time which meant that the roast potatoes were cool and hard and the vegetables only warm Breakfast was the same lots of food going cool and hard
Positive_Review: Staff were friendly and helpful and the location was close to what we wanted to see

Negative_Review: Breakfast service was just satisfactory Tables need to be cleared whilst you are still sitting there and getting more to eat as the tables are small and have no extra room for finished dishes
Positive_Review: Position was great to walk to most tourist attractions or bus or underground Covent Gardens market behind hotel Also very close to West End Theatres

Negative_Review: Breakfast to be seated in the dark Indian restaurant and tables being set for lunch around us while we were still eating our breakfast
Positive_Review: Everything was good

Negative_Review: To me every thing was very good
Positive_Review: I was at your hotel on my own as my husband had to be in hospital we were going to cancel but you were able to change our room without any fuss so I came rhe service I received from all your staff was wonderful the door men were very helpful at all times as I had a wheel chair

Negative_Review: On arrival we were met with a queue of people all being told their rooms were not read this was at 14 00 the designated time for booking in and that there would be a wait of no more than 1 hour 1 1 4 hours later I again approached he reception desk only to be told that my room was still not ready I was not happy with this and after a discussion with the reception manager another room was found for me and my husband We are both pensioners and had already had a 3 hour journey into London What we didn t need was this delay without even an offer of a cup of tea coffee whilst we waited Not a good start especially for a hotel of this standing

Negative_Review: on arrival we had to wait over an hour after the check in time for our room as it was not ready we were given a soft hot drink When we did finally get into our room whilst unpacking and getting refreshed to go out as we were by now running late another hotel guest managed to access our room with their allocated room card This was brought to the attention of the reception who blocked our card and were looking into how this happened

Negative_Review: For a 4 star hotel in such a great location they should be ashamed it could be something special and probably was at one time Looked dirty or perhaps tired and dated would be better words think 70 s Most of the staff could not care less but some were very nice Food not good at all had better meals at the Premier Inn Could not get the heating to work rang for assistance and neither could the maintenance guy On check in we were charged extra an extra 20 to take the room earlier then allocated a tiny room although we had paid extra for a larger executive double room When I spoke to reception I was told that we had been allocated the correct room Eventually but only after being very insistant they admitted they had made a mistake with our room and give me the keys to the executive double we had ordered The new room was unmistakable because of the big brass plaque on the door which said incredibly Executive Double What a scam if we had said nothing about the room they could have resold our room as an upgrade or similar Wont be booking again to stay at the Stand Palace shame because it could be a great hotel
Positive_Review: Comfy bed and location Sorry but cannot think of anything else

Negative_Review: Room is small and breakfast is expensive Its better to go to Covent Garden
Positive_Review: Staff are Very friendly and Raymond from concierge is really kind Location Shower is good

Negative_Review: I can not think of anything that could make it better as it was overall all good
Positive_Review: The breakfast was lovely The staff were very polite and helpful and happy

Negative_Review: The only negative there were two of us in a twin room and there was only one towel May have been an oversight on housekeeping s part and not a first world problem by any means If staying longer I would have taken steps to acquire more

Negative_Review: cost of single room expensive If you are put in a single room it should be only half price of that for a double room

Positive_Review: The only good aspect is the location near theatres Covent Garden and the Thames Upgraded to an executive room which was a good size but awful view see pic

Positive_Review: After staying at this establishment periodically for over twenty years and having praised it year after year very little to add The quality of the multicultural staff suggests very good training for dealing with customers from diverse backgrounds Indeed with such drastic cultural changes in staff and clientele it is to your credit that even old dowager and stiff upper types types can still be seen in the hotel And as usual special thanks to the front entrance guardians
